STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt" COLOR="#FFFFFF">2015 Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement </FONT><br><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt" COLOR="#FFFFFF">31.05.901.1-15 (4/15) </FONT></P>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">


<IMG SRC="g864659g98t06.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="font-size:36pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">


<IMG SRC="g864659g53r40.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Fellow Shareholders: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna Inc.&#146;s 2015 Annual Meeting of Shareholders will be held on Friday, May&nbsp;15, 2015, at 9:30 a.m. Eastern time at the JW Marriott Miami, in
Miami, Florida. We hope you will attend. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">This document includes the Notice of the Annual Meeting and Aetna&#146;s 2015 Proxy Statement. The Proxy
Statement provides information about Aetna and describes the business we will conduct at the meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">At the meeting, in addition to specific agenda
items, we will discuss generally the operations of Aetna. We welcome any questions you have concerning Aetna and will provide time during the meeting for questions from shareholders. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">We are pleased to take advantage of Securities and Exchange Commission rules that allow issuers to furnish proxy materials to their shareholders on the
Internet. These rules allow us to provide our shareholders with the information they need, while lowering the costs of delivery and reducing the environmental impact of our annual meeting. As a result, beginning on or about April&nbsp;3, 2015, we
are mailing a notice of Internet availability to many of our shareholders instead of paper copies of our Proxy Statement and our 2014 Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders. The notice contains instructions on how to access those documents
over the Internet. The notice also contains instructions on how shareholders can receive a paper copy of our proxy materials, including the Proxy Statement, our 2014 Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders and Proxy Card. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">If you plan to attend the meeting, please follow the advance registration instructions on page 71 of the Proxy Statement under &#147;How Can I Obtain an
Admission Ticket For the Annual Meeting?&#148; and on page 66 of the Proxy Statement. Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary must receive your written request for an admission ticket on or before May&nbsp;8, 2015. An admission ticket, which is required
for admission to the meeting, will be mailed to you prior to the meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Your vote is very important to us. If you are unable to attend the Annual
Meeting, it is still important that your shares be represented. Please vote your shares promptly. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Thank you for being an Aetna shareholder and for
the trust you have in our Company. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="right">


<IMG SRC="g864659g82k59.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>Mark T. Bertolini </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><I>Chairman and Chief Executive Officer </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right">April&nbsp;3, 2015 </P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:30pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>of&nbsp;Shareholders&nbsp;of&nbsp;Aetna&nbsp;Inc.</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD>

<P STYLE="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:16pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>9:30 a.m. Eastern time</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>JW Marriott Miami, in Miami, Florida</I></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Annual Meeting of the Shareholders of Aetna Inc.

<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="3"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board of Directors has fixed the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015, as the record date for determination of
the shareholders entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting or any adjournment thereof.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Annual Meeting is open to all shareholders as of the record date, the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015, or their authorized representatives.
Parking is available at the JW Marriott Miami, in Miami, Florida, and public parking is also available in the vicinity. <B>See page B-1 for directions to the JW Marriott Miami, in Miami, Florida</B>.</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">It is important that your shares be represented and voted at the Annual
Meeting. We urge you to vote by using the Internet, by telephone or, if you received a proxy/voting instruction card, by marking, dating, signing and returning it by mail in the postage-paid envelope furnished for that purpose. If you attend the
Annual Meeting, you may vote in person if you wish, even if you have voted previously.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">This Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement and Aetna&#146;s 2014 Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders are available on Aetna&#146;s
Internet website at <B>www.aetna.com/proxymaterials</B>.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Annual
Meeting will be audiocast live on the Internet at <B>www.aetna.com/about-us/investor-information.html</B>.</P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><A HREF="#toc864659_6">Director Retirement Age</A></P></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:24pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>THE&nbsp;AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:24pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>FOR THE SHAREHOLDER MEETING</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:24pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>TO BE HELD ON MAY 15, 2015</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>This Proxy Statement and the related 2014 Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders are available at
www.aetna.com/proxymaterials. </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Among other things, the &#147;QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS AND THE ANNUAL MEETING&#148; section
of this Proxy Statement, which begins on page 62, contains information regarding: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">The date, time and location of the Annual Meeting; </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">A list of the matters being submitted to shareholders for vote and the recommendations of the Board of Directors of Aetna Inc., if any, regarding each of
those matters; and </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Any control/identification number that a shareholder needs to access his or her form of proxy is included with his or her proxy or voting instruction
card or notice of Internet availability of proxy materials. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:22pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_2"></A>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:20pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="99%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.59em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>At Aetna Inc. (&#147;Aetna&#148;), we believe sound corporate governance principles are good for our business, our industry, the
competitive marketplace and all of those who place their trust in us. We have embraced the principles behind the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, as well as the governance rules for companies listed on the New York Stock Exchange (&#147;NYSE&#148;).
These principles are reflected in the structure and composition of our Board of Directors (our &#147;Board&#148;) and in the charters of our Board Committees, and are reinforced through Aetna&#146;s Code of Conduct, which applies to every Aetna
employee and every member of the Board.</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_3"></A>Aetna&#146;s Corporate Governance Guidelines </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:14pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna&#146;s Corporate Governance Guidelines (the &#147;Guidelines&#148;) provide the framework for the
governance of Aetna. The governance rules for companies listed on the NYSE and those contained in the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 are reflected in the Guidelines. The Guidelines address the role of the Board (including advising on key strategic,
financial and business objectives); the composition of the Board and selection of Directors; the functioning of the Board (including its annual self-evaluation); the Committees of the Board; the compensation of Directors; and the conduct and ethics
standards for Directors, including a prohibition against any nonmanagement Director having a direct or indirect material relationship with Aetna and its subsidiaries (collectively, the &#147;Company&#148;) except as authorized by the Board or the
Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (the &#147;Nominating Committee&#148;), and a prohibition against
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Company loans to, or guarantees of obligations of, Directors and their family members. The Guidelines are available at <B>www.aetna.com/governance</B>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">As a complement to our annual Board and Committee self-evaluations and as part of the Board&#146;s desire for continuous self-improvement, the Board has
engaged an independent third-party facilitator to conduct individual director interviews during 2015.&nbsp;This interview process is designed to provide Directors an additional opportunity to share valuable feedback with each other with the goal of
maximizing individual effectiveness. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board reviews the Company&#146;s corporate governance practices annually. These reviews include a
comparison of our current practices to those suggested by various groups or authorities active in corporate governance and to those of other public companies.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>1</B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_4"></A>Aetna&#146;s Board of Directors </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:14pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna&#146;s business and affairs are managed under the direction of the Board. Under Aetna&#146;s
By-Laws, the size of the Board may range from 3 to 21 members, with any change to the size of the Board to be designated from time to time by the Board. The Board currently consists of 13 individuals. The Board appoints Aetna&#146;s officers, who
serve at the discretion of the Board. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under Aetna&#146;s Articles of Incorporation, at each annual meeting of shareholders, all of the Directors
are elected to hold office for a term of one year and until their successors are elected and qualified. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_5"></A>Director Elections
&#151; Majority Voting Standard </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:14pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna&#146;s Articles of Incorporation provide for majority voting in uncontested elections of Directors.
Under the Articles of Incorporation, a Director nominee will be elected if the number of votes cast &#147;for&#148; the nominee exceeds the number of votes cast &#147;against&#148; the nominee. An abstention will not have any effect on the outcome
of the election. In contested elections, those in which there are more candidates for election than the number of Directors to be elected and one or more candidates have been properly proposed by shareholders, the voting standard will be a plurality
of votes cast. Under Pennsylvania law, if an incumbent Director nominee does not receive a majority of the votes cast in an uncontested election, the incumbent Director will continue to serve on the Board until his or her
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
successor is elected and qualified. To address this situation, the Guidelines require any incumbent nominee for Director in an uncontested election who receives more &#147;against&#148; votes
than &#147;for&#148; votes to promptly submit his or her resignation for consideration by the Nominating Committee. The Nominating Committee is then required to recommend to the Board the action to be taken with respect to the resignation, and the
Board is required to act on the resignation, in each case within a reasonable period of time. Aetna will disclose promptly to the public each such resignation and decision by the Board. New nominees not already serving on the Board who fail to
receive a majority of votes cast in an uncontested election will not be elected to the Board in the first instance. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_6"></A>Director Retirement Age
</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:14pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Nominating Committee regularly assesses the appropriate size and composition of the Board and, among
other matters, whether any vacancies on the Board are expected due to retirement or otherwise. The current
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Director retirement age is 76. Each year, the Nominating Committee considers the characteristics and performance of each individual Director candidate as part of its nomination process,
regardless of the candidate&#146;s age. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_7"></A>Executive Sessions
</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:14pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna&#146;s nonmanagement Directors meet in regularly scheduled executive sessions without management
present at every regular Aetna Board meeting. During 2014, the nonmanagement Directors, each of whom is independent other than Dr.&nbsp;Coye, met eight times to discuss certain Board policies, processes and practices, the performance and proposed
performance-based compensation of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, management
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
succession and other matters relating to the Company and the functioning of the Board. In addition, Aetna&#146;s independent Directors met once in executive session during 2014 without management
present. Dr.&nbsp;Coye was an independent Director until September 2010, when she joined UCLA Health System; UCLA Health System provides hospital services to our members as explained on page 5.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>2</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_8"></A>Board Leadership Structure and the Lead Director </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:14pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board, assisted by the Nominating Committee, regularly reviews the leadership structure of the
Company, including whether the position of Chairman should be held by an independent Director. The Board believes that the decision to combine or separate the positions of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer is highly dependent on the strengths and
personalities of the personnel involved and must take into account current business conditions and the environment in which the Company operates. The Board also strongly believes Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini, who continues to serve as Chief Executive Officer,
is a successful leader of the Board and an effective bridge between the Directors and Company management. While the Board has decided to
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
keep the roles of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer combined at this time, the Board also has taken steps to ensure that it effectively carries out its responsibility for independent oversight
of management. These steps include the election of a Lead Director (with comprehensive and clearly delineated duties); the scheduling at every regular Board meeting of an executive session of the nonmanagement Directors (without Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini
or other management attendees present); and assuring that substantially all of the nonmanagement Directors are independent. In addition, each Board Committee meets regularly in executive session without management attendees.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%"></TD></TR>


<TR BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.39em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>The duties of the Lead Director include
the following:</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;presiding at all meetings of the Board at which the Chairman
is not present, including executive sessions of the nonmanagement Directors;</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;approving meeting agendas and schedules to assure there is
sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;approving information sent to the Board;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;calling special meetings of the Board (including meetings of
the nonmanagement or independent Directors); and</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;making himself or herself available as appropriate for
consultation and direct communication upon the reasonable request of a major shareholder.</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Edward J. Ludwig, an independent Director, has served as the Lead Director since February&nbsp;24, 2012. The Lead
Director is elected annually. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:27pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_9"></A>Communications with the Board </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:14pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">To contact Aetna&#146;s Chairman or its Lead Director or to send a communication to the entire Board you may contact: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9.5pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>

<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9.5pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g864659g05e37.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>Mark T. Bertolini</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Chairman
and Chief Executive Officer</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna Inc.</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">151
Farmington Avenue</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Hartford, CT 06156</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">or</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify">


<IMG SRC="g864659g05e37.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>Edward J. Ludwig</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Lead
Director</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">P.O. Box 370205</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">West&nbsp;Hartford, CT
06137-0205</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:8pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Communications sent to Aetna&#146;s Chairman will be delivered directly to him. All communications to the
Lead Director or addressed to the nonmanagement Directors will be kept confidential and forwarded directly to the Lead Director.
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Items that are unrelated to a Director&#146;s duties and responsibilities as a Board member, such as junk mail, may be excluded by the Corporate Secretary.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_10"></A>Director Independence
</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:14pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board has established guidelines (&#147;Director Independence Standards&#148;) to assist it in
determining Director independence. In accordance with the Director
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Independence Standards, the Board must determine that each independent Director has no material relationship with the Company other than as a Director and/or a shareholder
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>3</B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
of the Company. Consistent with the NYSE listing standards, the Director Independence Standards specify the criteria by which the independence of our Directors will be determined, including
guidelines for Directors and their immediate family members with respect to past employment or affiliation with the Company or its external auditor. The Director Independence Standards are available at
<B>www.aetna.com/about-us/corporate-governance.html</B>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Pursuant to the Director Independence Standards, the Board undertook its annual review of
Director independence in February 2015. The purpose of this review was to determine whether any nonmanagement Director&#146;s relationships or transactions are inconsistent with a determination that the Director is independent. During this review,
the Board considered transactions and relationships between each Director or any member of his or her immediate family (or any entity of which a Director or an immediate family member is a partner, major shareholder or officer) and the Company. The
Board also considered whether there were any transactions or relationships between Directors or any member of their immediate family with members of the Company&#146;s senior management or their affiliates. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">As a result of this review, the Board affirmatively determined in its business judgment that each of Fernando Aguirre, Frank M. Clark, Betsy Z. Cohen,
Roger N. Farah, Barbara Hackman Franklin, Jeffrey E. Garten, Ellen M. Hancock, Richard J. Harrington, Edward J. Ludwig, Joseph P. Newhouse and Olympia J. Snowe, each of whom also is standing for election at the Annual Meeting, is independent as
defined in the NYSE listing standards and under Aetna&#146;s
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Director Independence Standards and that any relationship with the Company (either directly or as a partner, major shareholder or officer of any organization that has a relationship with the
Company) is not material under the independence thresholds contained in the NYSE listing standards and under Aetna&#146;s Director Independence Standards. The Board has determined that Molly J. Coye, M.D., is not independent under the NYSE listing
standards and under Aetna&#146;s Director Independence Standards due to the Company&#146;s business relationship with her employer. Dr.&nbsp;Coye is not involved in that relationship. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In determining that each of the nonmanagement Directors other than Dr.&nbsp;Coye is independent, the Board considered that the Company in the ordinary
course of business sells products and services to, purchases products and services from, and/or makes charitable contributions to companies and other entities at which some of our Directors or their immediate family members are or have been officers
and/or significant equity holders or have certain other relationships. Specifically, the Board considered the existence of and approved the transactions described below, all of which were made in the ordinary course of business, on terms and
conditions substantially similar to those with unrelated third parties, and which the Board believes were in, or not inconsistent with, the best interests of the Company. The aggregate amounts paid to or received from these companies or other
entities in each of the last three years did not exceed the threshold in the Director Independence Standards (i.e., the greater of $1 million or 2% of the other company&#146;s consolidated gross revenues) for 2014, except in the case of
Dr.&nbsp;Coye. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>2014 SALES AND OTHER AMOUNTS RECEIVED BY THE
COMPANY </B></P>

million</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:1pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(A)</I></TD>

<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(B)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Percentages are determined by dividing (1)&nbsp;calendar year 2014 purchases by the Company by (2)&nbsp;the applicable entity&#146;s most recently
available annual consolidated gross revenues. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(C)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Dr.&nbsp;Coye is Chief Innovation Officer of the UCLA Health System, which includes health institutions and other health care providers. These providers
are part of the Company&#146;s broad national network of hospitals and physicians and other health care providers. Dr.&nbsp;Coye has no interest in or involvement with the UCLA Health System&#146;s relationship with the Company.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(D)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Aetna does not use Harvard for any consulting or advisory services; Harvard provides the medical content for Aetna InteliHealth and reviews Care
Considerations for Active Health. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In addition to the transactions in the table above on this page, the Company also may, in the ordinary
course of its business, hold as investments equity and/or debt securities in corporations or organizations with which Directors are or were affiliated. The amount of each such holding is below the 5% threshold amount in the Director Independence
Standards. Further, in 2014, the Company donated $500,000 to the U.S. Chamber of Commerce Foundation, a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organization. The spouse of Senator Snowe formerly was the President of the U.S. Chamber of
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Commerce Foundation. The Board determined that none of these relationships or contributions was material or impaired the independence of any Director. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">All members of the Audit Committee, the Committee on&nbsp;Compensation and Talent Management (the &#147;Compensation Committee&#148;) and the Nominating
Committee are, in the business judgment of the Board, independent Directors as defined in the NYSE listing standards and in Aetna&#146;s Director Independence Standards.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_11"></A>Compensation Committee
Interlocks and Insider Participation </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">As of March&nbsp;13, 2015, the members of the Compensation Committee are Roger N. Farah (Chair), Frank M.
Clark, Barbara Hackman Franklin, Jeffrey E. Garten and Edward J. Ludwig. None of the members of the Compensation Committee has ever been an officer or employee of the Company. There are no interlocking relationships between any of our executive
officers or Compensation Committee members. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:27pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_12"></A>Meeting Attendance </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board and its Committees meet throughout the year on a set schedule and also hold special meetings
from time to time, as appropriate. During 2014, the Board met eleven times. The average attendance of Directors at all meetings during the year was 92.8%, and no Director attended fewer than 75% of the aggregate number of Board and
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Committee meetings that he or she was eligible to attend. It is the policy of the Board that all Directors should be present at Aetna&#146;s Annual Meeting of Shareholders. Eleven of the twelve
Directors then in office and standing for election attended Aetna&#146;s 2014 Annual Meeting of Shareholders. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_13"></A>Aetna&#146;s Code of
Conduct </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna&#146;s Code of Conduct applies to every Aetna employee and to every member of the Board and is
available at <B>www.aetna.com/governance</B>. The Code of Conduct is designed to ensure that Aetna&#146;s business is conducted in a consistently legal and ethical manner. The Code of Conduct includes policies on employee conduct, conflicts of
interest and the protection of confidential information and requires compliance with all applicable laws and regulations. Aetna will
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
disclose any amendments to the Code of Conduct or waivers of the Code of Conduct relating to Aetna&#146;s Directors, executive officers and principal financial and accounting officers or persons
performing similar functions on its website at <B>www.aetna.com/governance</B> within four business days following the date of any such amendment or waiver. To date, no such waivers have been requested or granted.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>5</B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_14"></A><A NAME="toc864659_54"></A>Related Party Transaction Policy </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under Aetna&#146;s Code of Conduct, the Board or an independent Committee reviews any potential conflicts
between the Company and any Director. In addition, the Board has adopted a written Related Party Transaction Policy (the &#147;Policy&#148;) which applies to Directors, executive officers, significant shareholders and their immediate family members
(each a &#147;Related Person&#148;). Under the Policy, all transactions involving the Company in which a Related Person has a direct or indirect material interest must be reviewed and approved (1)&nbsp;by the Board or the Nominating Committee if
involving a Director, (2)&nbsp;by the Board or the Audit Committee if involving an executive officer or (3)&nbsp;by the Board if involving a significant shareholder. The Board or&nbsp;appropriate Committee considers relevant facts and
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
circumstances, which may include, without limitation, the commercial reasonableness of the terms, the benefit to the Company, opportunity costs of alternate transactions, the materiality and
character of the Related Person&#146;s direct or indirect interest, and the actual or apparent conflict of interest of the Related Person. A transaction may be approved if it is determined, in the Board&#146;s or appropriate Committee&#146;s
reasonable business judgment, that the transaction is in, or not inconsistent with, the best interests of the Company and its shareholders, and considering the interests of other relevant constituents, when deemed appropriate. Determinations of
materiality are made by the Board or appropriate Committee, as applicable. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:12pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="99%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>


<TR BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><FONT
 COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>BOARD&#146;S ROLE IN THE OVERSIGHT OF RISK</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>The Company relies on its comprehensive enterprise risk management (&#147;ERM&#148;) process to aggregate, monitor, measure and
manage risk. The ERM process is dynamic and ongoing. It is designed to identify the most important risks facing the Company as well as to prioritize those risks in the context of the Company&#146;s overall strategy. The Company&#146;s ERM team is
led by the Company&#146;s Chief Enterprise Risk Officer, who is also the Company&#146;s Chief Financial Officer. In collaboration with the Audit Committee and the Board, the ERM team annually conducts a risk assessment of the Company&#146;s
businesses. All of our key business leaders are involved in the risk assessment process. The risk assessment is presented to, and reviewed by, the Audit Committee and, after reflecting the Audit Committee&#146;s views, the list of enterprise risks
is then reviewed and approved by the Board. As part of their reviews, the Audit Committee and the Board consider the internal governance structure for managing risks, and the Board assigns responsibility for ongoing oversight of each identified risk
to a specific Committee of the Board or to the Board. Discussions of assigned risks are then incorporated into the agenda for each Committee (or the Board) throughout the year. Risk management is ongoing, and the importance assigned to identified
risks can change and new risks can emerge during the year as the Company develops and implements its strategy. Consequently, our Chief Enterprise Risk Officer, in consultation with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, monitors risk management
and mitigation activities across the organization throughout the year and reports periodically to the Audit Committee and the Board concerning the Company&#146;s risk management profile and activities. As a result, we believe having the same
individual serve as both Chairman and Chief Executive Officer assists the Board in performing its risk oversight function because the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer is directly involved in the Company&#146;s ERM process. The Audit Committee
also meets regularly in private sessions with the Company&#146;s Chief Enterprise Risk Officer.</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>6</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_50"></A>Board and Committee Membership; Committee Descriptions </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna&#146;s Board oversees and guides the Company&#146;s management and its business. Committees support
the role of the Board on issues that are better addressed by smaller, more focused subsets of Directors. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The following table presents, as of
March&nbsp;13, 2015, the key standing Committees of the Board, the membership of such
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Committees and the number of times each such Committee met in 2014. Charters adopted by the Board for each of the six Committees listed below are available at
<B>www.aetna.com/investors-aetna/governance/committees.html</B>. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_51"></A>Committee Functions and Responsibilities </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Functions and responsibilities of the key
standing Committees of Aetna&#146;s Board are described below and on the following pages. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Audit Committee</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt"><B>


<IMG SRC="g864659g15z43.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1px solid #000000; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Richard J. Harrington</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Chair</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board has determined in its business judgment that all members of the Audit Committee meet the independence, financial literacy and expertise
requirements for audit committee members set forth in the NYSE listing standards. Additionally, the Board has determined in its business judgment that Messrs. Aguirre, Harrington and Newhouse and Ms. Hancock, based on his or her</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10.5pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt; padding-right:8pt">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">background and experience (including that described in this Proxy&nbsp;Statement), has the requisite attributes of an &#147;audit committee financial
expert&#148; as defined by the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;). The Audit Committee assists the Board in its oversight of (1)&nbsp;the integrity of the financial statements of the Company, (2)&nbsp;the
qualifications and independence of the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm (the &#147;Independent Accountants&#148;), (3)&nbsp;the performance of the Company&#146;s internal audit function and the Independent Accountants,
and (4)&nbsp;compliance by the Company with legal and regulatory requirements. The Audit Committee periodically discusses management&#146;s policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management, and periodically discusses with the Independent
Accountants, management and the Internal Audit department significant financial risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor, control and report such exposures. The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment,
compensation, retention and oversight of the work of the Independent Accountants and any other accounting firm engaged to perform audit, review or attest services (including the resolution of any disagreements between management and any auditor
regarding financial reporting). The Independent Accountants and any other such accounting firm report directly to the Audit Committee. The Company&#146;s Chief Compliance Officer is authorized to communicate promptly and personally to the Audit
Committee on all matters he or she deems appropriate, including, without limitation, any matter involving criminal conduct or potential criminal conduct. The Audit Committee is empowered, to the extent it deems necessary or appropriate, to retain
outside legal, accounting or other advisers having special competence as necessary to assist it in fulfilling its responsibilities and duties. The Audit Committee has available from the Company such funding as the Audit Committee determines for
compensation to the Independent Accountants and any other accounting firm or other advisers engaged by the Audit Committee, and for the Audit Committee&#146;s ordinary administrative expenses. The Audit Committee conducts an annual evaluation of its
performance. For more information regarding the role, responsibilities and limitations of the Audit Committee, please refer to the Report of the Audit Committee beginning on page 55.</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Audit Committee can be confidentially contacted by employees and
others wishing to raise concerns or complaints about the Company&#146;s accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters by calling AlertLine<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">&reg;</SUP>, an independent toll-free service, at
1-888-891-8910 (available seven days a week, 24 hours a day), or by writing to: Aetna Inc. Audit Committee, c/o Corporate Compliance, P.O. Box 370205, West Hartford, CT 06137-0205.</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>8</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Committee on Compensation and Talent Management</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt"><B>


<IMG SRC="g864659g43x14.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1px solid #000000; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I></I><B>Roger N. Farah</B><I></I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Chair</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board has determined in its business judgment that all members of the Compensation Committee meet the independence requirements set forth in the NYSE
listing standards and in Aetna&#146;s Director Independence Standards. The Compensation Committee is directly responsible for reviewing and approving the corporate goals and objectives relevant to Chief Executive Officer</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10.5pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt; padding-right:8pt">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">and other executive officer compensation; evaluating the Chief Executive Officer&#146;s and other executive officers&#146; performance in light of those
goals and objectives; and establishing the Chief Executive Officer&#146;s and other executive officers&#146; compensation levels based on this evaluation. The Chief Executive Officer&#146;s compensation is determined after reviewing the Chief
Executive Officer&#146;s performance and consulting with the nonmanagement Directors of the Board. The Compensation Committee also evaluates and determines the compensation of the Company&#146;s executive officers and oversees the compensation and
benefit plans, policies and programs of the Company. The Compensation Committee consults with the Chief Executive Officer regarding the compensation of all executive officers other than the Chief Executive Officer, but the Compensation Committee
does not delegate its authority with regard to these executive compensation decisions. The Compensation Committee reviews and approves executive compensation philosophy and strategy, including peer group and target compensation positioning. The
Compensation Committee also administers Aetna&#146;s equity-based incentive plans and Aetna&#146;s 2001 Annual Incentive Plan (the &#147;Annual Incentive Plan&#148;). The Compensation Committee reviews and makes recommendations, as appropriate, to
the Board as to the development and succession plans for the senior management of the Company. The Compensation Committee also reviews the Company&#146;s talent management and diversity strategies and conducts an annual evaluation of its
performance.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Compensation Committee has the authority to retain
counsel and other experts or consultants as it may deem appropriate. The Compensation Committee has the sole authority to select, retain and terminate any consultant used to assist the Compensation Committee and has the sole authority to approve
each consultant&#146;s fees and other retention terms. When selecting a compensation consultant, legal or other advisor, the Committee considers (i)&nbsp;the provision of other services to the Company; (ii)&nbsp;the amount of fees paid to the
advisor as a percentage of the advisor&#146;s total revenue; (iii)&nbsp;the policies and procedures of the advisor&#146;s employer that are designed to prevent conflicts of interest; (iv)&nbsp;any business or personal relationship between the
advisor and a member of the Committee; (v)&nbsp;any Company stock owned by the advisor; (vi)&nbsp;any business or personal relationship of the advisor and an executive officer of the Company; and (vii)&nbsp;any other factor deemed relevant to the
advisor&#146;s independence from management. In accordance with this authority, the Compensation Committee engaged Meridian Compensation Partners (&#147;Meridian&#148;) as independent outside compensation consultants to advise the Compensation
Committee on all matters related to Chief Executive Officer and other executive compensation. The Company may not engage Meridian for any services other than in support of the Compensation Committee without the prior approval of the Chair of the
Compensation Committee. Meridian also advises the Nominating Committee regarding Director compensation. The Company does not engage Meridian for any services other than in support of these Committees. A representative of Meridian attended five of
the Compensation Committee&#146;s meetings in 2014.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10.5pt" ALIGN="center">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Executive Committee</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>

<IMG SRC="g864659g53r40.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1px solid #000000; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I></I><B>Mark T. Bertolini</B><I></I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Chair</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">This Committee is authorized to act on behalf of the Board between regularly scheduled Board meetings, usually when timing is critical. The Executive
Committee has the authority to retain counsel and other experts or consultants as it may deem appropriate.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Investment and Finance Committee</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>

</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1px solid #000000; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I></I><B>Edward J. Ludwig</B><I></I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Chair</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">This Committee assists the Board in reviewing the Company&#146;s investment policies, strategies, transactions and performance and in overseeing the
Company&#146;s capital and financial resources. The Investment and Finance Committee has the authority to retain counsel and other experts or consultants as it may deem appropriate. The Investment and Finance Committee conducts an</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10.5pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt; padding-right:8pt">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">annual evaluation of its performance.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>Medical Affairs Committee</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
