<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(a)</I></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" >&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Refer to &#147;Director Charitable Award Program&#148; on page 24 for information about the Charitable Award Program, which was discontinued for any new
Director joining the Board after January&nbsp;25, 2008. Amounts shown are pre-tax and do not reflect the anticipated tax benefit to the Company from the charitable contributions under the Charitable Award Program. Directors derive no personal
financial or tax benefit from this program. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(b)</I></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" >&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>These amounts represent matching contributions made by Aetna Foundation, Inc. pursuant to Aetna&#146;s charitable giving programs, which encourage
contributions by eligible persons to charitable organizations. Through the 2014 Aetna Foundation Matching Grants Program for Directors, up to $15,000 in eligible contributions per Director per program year are matched at 100% by Aetna Foundation,
Inc. Amounts shown are pre-tax. Directors derive no personal financial or tax benefit from this program. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="0%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(5)</I></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" >&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>The Company has not granted stock appreciation rights (&#147;SARs&#148;) or stock options to nonmanagement Directors since 2004. Therefore, no amount
associated with SARs or stock options is included in this column. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, there were no outstanding SARs or stock options held by nonmanagement Directors. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_22"></A>Additional Director Compensation Information </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Director Deferrals </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The amounts shown in the &#147;Fees Earned or Paid in Cash&#148; and &#147;Stock Awards&#148; columns of
the 2014 Director Compensation table include amounts that were deferred by Directors during 2014 under the Director Plan. Under the Director Plan, nonmanagement Directors may defer payment of some or all of their annual retainer fees, vested RSUs
and dividend equivalents paid on stock units to an unfunded stock unit account or unfunded interest account until after they have resigned or retired (as defined in the Director Plan) from the Board or elect to diversify their stock unit holdings as
described below. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">During the period of deferral, amounts deferred to the stock unit account track the value of the Common Stock and earn dividend
equivalents. During the period of deferral, amounts
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
deferred to the interest account accrue interest pursuant to a formula equal to the rate of interest paid from time to time under the fixed interest rate fund option of the Aetna 401(k) Plan,
which was 1.90% for the period January to March 2014; 1.95% for the period April to June 2014; and 2.05% for the period July to September 2014 and for the period October to December 2014. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under the Director Plan, beginning at age 68, Directors are allowed to make an annual election to diversify up to 100% of their voluntary deferrals into
the stock unit account out of stock units and into an interest account. During 2014, no Director made such a diversification election. Directors who make a diversification election remain subject to the Board&#146;s Director Stock Ownership
Guidelines. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Stock Unit and Restricted Stock Unit Awards
</B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">On May&nbsp;30, 2014, Aetna granted each nonmanagement Director then in office 2,064 RSUs under the
Director Plan. The full grant date fair value of the RSUs granted to each nonmanagement Director was $160,063. The RSUs vest in quarterly increments over a one-year period beginning May&nbsp;30, 2014, and are payable at the end of the one-year
period in shares of Common Stock or can be deferred under the Director Plan to a stock unit account or an interest account as described above. The RSUs granted to
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
a nonmanagement Director will vest immediately if the Director ceases to be a Director because of death, disability, retirement or acceptance of a position in government service. All RSUs granted
to nonmanagement Directors also will vest upon a change in control of Aetna (as defined in the Director Plan). The unvested RSUs granted to nonmanagement Directors do not earn dividend equivalents, have no voting rights and are not transferable.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>23</B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>I. ELECTION OF DIRECTORS </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Prior to 2012, nonmanagement Directors, upon their initial election to the Board, received a one-time
grant of Initial Units convertible upon retirement from Board service into 6,000 shares of Common Stock. Generally, to become fully vested in the Initial Units, a Director had to complete three years of service following the grant. If service was
terminated sooner by reason of death, disability, retirement or acceptance of a position in government service, a Director was entitled to receive the full grant if the Director had completed a minimum of six consecutive months of service as a
Director from the date of grant. </P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">A Director&#146;s right with respect to unvested Initial Units also would have vested upon a change in
control of Aetna (as defined in the Director Plan). If a Director terminated Board service prior to completion of three years of service from the grant date of any Initial Units that had not otherwise vested under the terms of the Director Plan, the
Director would have been entitled to receive a pro rata portion of the award. Although Directors received dividend equivalents on the Initial Units, they had no voting rights with respect to the Initial Units granted. The Initial Units granted were
not transferable. All of the current nonmanagement Directors other than Senator Snowe received Initial Units. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Director Charitable Award Program </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Prior to January&nbsp;26, 2008, Aetna maintained a Director Charitable Award Program (the
&#147;Program&#148;) for nonmanagement Directors serving on the Board. After a review of the Program and competitive practices, the Board decided to close the Program, and any Director who first joins the Board after January&nbsp;25, 2008 will not
be eligible to participate. However, to recognize pre-existing commitments, the Program remains in place for Directors serving prior to that date. Under the Program, Aetna will make a charitable contribution of $1 million in ten equal annual
installments allocated among up to five charitable organizations recommended by a participating Director once he or she reaches age 72. For Mr.&nbsp;Farah, who joined the Board in 2007, contributions would occur once he reaches age 75. The Program
may be funded indirectly by life insurance on the lives of the participating Directors. Messrs. Harrington and Aguirre and Senator Snowe are not eligible to participate in the Program because they joined the Board after the Program closed to new
Directors. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Beneficiary organizations recommended by Directors must be, among other things, tax exempt under Section&nbsp;501(c)(3) of the Internal
Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
&#147;Code&#148;). Donations Aetna ultimately makes are expected to be deductible from Aetna&#146;s taxable income for purposes of U.S. federal and other income taxes. Directors derive no
personal financial or tax benefit from the Program, since all insurance proceeds and charitable deductions accrue solely to Aetna. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Program
values included in footnote 4 to the 2014 Director Compensation table represent an estimate of the present value of the total annual economic net cost of the Program, pre-tax, for current and former Directors, allocated equally among the Directors
still participating in the Program. The present value calculation considers estimates of (a)&nbsp;premiums paid on whole life insurance policies purchased with respect to certain of the Directors to fund part of the Program; (b)&nbsp;the expected
future charitable contributions to be paid by Aetna on behalf of current and former Directors; (c)&nbsp;expenses associated with administering the Program; and (d)&nbsp;the expected future proceeds from such whole life insurance policies which are,
in turn, based on expected mortality, as well as assumptions related to future investment returns of the policies. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Other Benefits </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna provides $150,000 of group life insurance and $100,000 of business travel accident insurance (which
includes accidental death and dismemberment coverage) for its nonmanagement Directors. Optional medical, dental and long-term care coverage for nonmanagement Directors and their eligible dependents also is available to Directors at a cost similar to
that charged to Aetna employees and may be continued into retirement by eligible Directors. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna also reimburses nonmanagement Directors for the
out-of-pocket expenses they incur that pertain to Board
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
membership, including travel expenses incurred in connection with attending Board, Committee and shareholder meetings, and for other Aetna business-related expenses (including the
business-related travel expenses of spouses if they are specifically invited to attend an event). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">From time to time, Aetna also may transport
Directors to and from Board meetings or Directors and their guests to and from other Aetna business functions on Company aircraft.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>24</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>I. ELECTION OF DIRECTORS </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>2015 Nonmanagement Director Compensation </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">On September&nbsp;18, 2014, the Nominating Committee and Meridian reviewed a director compensation study
prepared by Meridian, and on November&nbsp;20, 2014, the Board voted to approve the Director compensation package for nonmanagement Directors for 2015. The Board set the total value of target compensation for 2015 at approximately
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
$267,110, consisting of stock-based compensation, cash and benefits and excluding the estimated cost of the Charitable Award Program. The annual Board retainer and Lead Director, Chair and
Committee retainers for 2015 were set at 2014 levels. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_23"></A>Section&nbsp;16(a)
Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Section&nbsp;16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires our Directors, our executive
officers and certain other persons to file reports of holdings and transactions in our Common Stock with the SEC. Based on our records and other information, we believe that during our fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, our Directors and
executive officers timely met all applicable SEC filing requirements. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_24"></A>Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners, Directors,
Nominees and Executive Officers </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The following table presents, as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the names of the only persons known to Aetna to be
the beneficial owners of more than 5% of the outstanding shares of our Common Stock. The information set forth in the table below and in the related footnotes was furnished by the identified persons to the SEC. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>I. ELECTION OF DIRECTORS </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_25"></A>Beneficial Ownership Table </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The following table presents, as of March 13, 2015, the beneficial ownership of, and other interests in,
shares of our Common Stock of each current Director, each Nominee, each executive officer named in the 2014 Summary
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Compensation Table on page 39 and Aetna&#146;s Directors and executive officers as a group. The information set forth in the table below and in the related footnotes has been furnished by the
respective persons. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

51,167 shares (including 7,060 shares held through the Aetna 401(k) Plan). Also includes 2,068,972 shares that executive officers have the right to acquire currently or within 60 days of March 13, 2015, upon the exercise of SARs. At March 13, 2015,

performance stock appreciation rights (&#147;PSARs&#148;) that do not earn dividend equivalents and have no voting rights. Common stock equivalents also include vested stock units that earn dividend equivalents but do not have voting rights.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

see &#147;Stock Unit and Restricted Stock Unit Awards&#148; beginning on page 23. Stock units track the value of the Common Stock and vested stock units earn dividend equivalents that may be reinvested, but do not have voting rights. Also includes
RSUs granted to each nonmanagement Director other than Senator Snowe under the Director Plan which are unvested, or vested but not yet payable, and are payable in shares of the Common Stock. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

January&nbsp;5, 2016, March&nbsp;3, 2017 and March 2, 2018, respectively. Also includes 129,314 MSUs that may vest on February 1, 2016, based on the average closing price of the Common Stock for the final 30 trading days of the vesting period. Also

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:22pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_26"></A>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:30pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:13pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">I.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" STYLE="font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><B>2014 &#151; A Year of Strong Operating Performance and Effective Execution of&nbsp;Our&nbsp;Strategy </B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:12pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>A.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" STYLE="font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>2014 Company Financial Performance At-a-Glance </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="24%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="23%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="23%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Total shareholder</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">return:</P> <P STYLE="font-size:30pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-size:20pt">31%</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Operating earnings
per&nbsp;share:</P> <P STYLE="font-size:16pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-size:20pt">$6.70</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-size:20pt">7%</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-size:10pt"> increase over&nbsp;2013</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Dividend increase
of</P> <P STYLE="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-size:20pt">11%</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-size:10pt"> to:</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-size:20pt">$1.00</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-size:10pt"> per share
(annualized)</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:16pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Fifth increase to</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">dividend since 2011</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-right:8pt" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Medical Membership increased to approximately</P> <P STYLE="font-size:16pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-size:20pt">23.5</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-size:10pt"> million</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-size:20pt">6%</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-size:10pt"> increase over&nbsp;2013</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:12pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>B.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top" STYLE="font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>2014 Company Performance and Related Impact on Compensation Decisions </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Company&#146;s financial performance in 2014 was strong and continued to reflect the Company&#146;s attention to capital deployment, a balanced
business mix and effective execution of our strategy. During 2014, the Company delivered: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Strong Shareholder Returns.</I></B> During 2014, our stock price increased 30% from $68.59 on December 31, 2013 to $88.83 on December&nbsp;31, 2014. On
March&nbsp;13, 2015, our stock closed at $104.09. Our total shareholder return for 2014 was just over 31%, and our three-year cumulative total shareholder return was 119.75%. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">


<IMG SRC="g864659g65n02.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:18pt; margin-right:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Competitors include: Cigna Corporation, Humana Inc., UnitedHealth Group
Incorporated and Anthem, Inc. (formerly WellPoint, Inc.) </P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Solid Operating Earnings.</I></B> For 2014, we reported operating earnings per share of $6.70, a 7% increase over 2013. This brings our 5-year
operating earnings per share compound annual growth rate to 15%, well ahead of our managed health care peers. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g864659g78x37.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Increase to Dividend.</I></B> On November&nbsp;21, 2014, the Company announced an 11% increase to its quarterly cash dividend from $0.225 per share
($0.90 annualized) to $0.25 per share ($1.00 annualized), reflecting continued confidence in our strategy and our commitment to enhancing total return for our shareholders. This is the fifth increase to our dividend since February 2011 and reflects
a five year dividend growth rate of approximately 67%. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g864659g46o79.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:18pt; margin-right:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">* Projected. Declaration and payment of future dividends are at the discretion of
the Board and may be adjusted as business needs or market conditions change. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Strong Growth in Medical Membership.</I></B> In 2014, we grew our medical membership by approximately 1.4&nbsp;million members to 23.5&nbsp;million, a
6% increase over 2013. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Pre-tax Operating Margin in High Single Digits.</I></B> Aetna reported a 2014 pre-tax operating margin of 7.6%, consistent with our high single digit
target. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Excellent Progress on Strategic Initiatives.</I></B> In 2014, Aetna reported excellent progress on several strategic initiatives. Through acquisitions
and developing technologies, Aetna has created a unique set of capabilities that permit the Company to capitalize on exciting new consumer and provider opportunities in the marketplace. During 2014, we were able to accelerate the financial synergies
from the Coventry Health Care, Inc. (&#147;Coventry&#148;) acquisition, price or solve for nearly $1 billion in new fees and taxes related to health care reform and close a meaningful funding gap for 2014 Medicare Advantage rates. In addition, we
enrolled nearly 600,000 public exchange members, while exceeding our initial profitability projections. Further, we bolstered our consumer platform through the acquisition of bSwift LLC and continued to advance our efforts to shift the
fee-for-service-based health care model toward patient-centric population health management. Our Accountable Care Solutions business, which differentiates us in the
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left" COLOR="#000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
marketplace, reduces medical costs and drives membership growth through integrated solutions using our technology assets. This business doubled the membership covered by value-based contracts
(&#147;VBCs&#148;) to more than 3&nbsp;million members and increased the percent of our medical costs that run through VBC&#146;s to 28% of our total medical spending. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B><I>Operating earnings per share and pre-tax operating margin are non-GAAP financial measures. Refer to Annex A to this Proxy Statement for a
reconciliation of these and other non-GAAP financial measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measures.</I></B> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B><I>The Company&#146;s
executive pay decisions reflect the alignment between executive compensation and Company performance:</I></B> </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Annual Bonus Payments Above Target.</I></B> Our annual bonus program (the &#147;ABP&#148;), which for 2014 was weighted 80% on annual financial
metrics, was funded at 133.4% of target. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Long-Term Incentive Equity Programs Vested Above Target.</I></B>&nbsp;The 2013 PSU program vested at 129.35% in the aggregate based on performance
during 2013 and 2014. The 36-month portion of the 2012 MSU program vested at 150% based on exceeding the two-year earnings and revenue goals and three-year stock price growth surpassing 50%. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>C.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top" STYLE="font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>2014 &#147;Say on Pay&#148; Vote/Compensation Plan Design Changes </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">At
our 2014 annual meeting, 88.41% of the votes cast at the meeting voted to approve, on a non-binding advisory basis, the Company&#146;s 2013 Named Executive Officer (&#147;NEO&#148;) compensation, reflecting strong concurrence with the Company&#146;s
executive compensation program. Despite this solid shareholder vote in favor of our executive compensation programs, the Compensation Committee continues to refine the Company&#146;s programs to improve their alignment with the interests of our
shareholders and to respond to shareholder feedback. During 2014, with the assistance of its independent compensation consultant, Meridian, the Compensation Committee reviewed the Company&#146;s executive compensation programs. As a result of this
review and reflecting conversations the Company has had with certain of its largest shareholders, the Company adopted the following compensation program changes for 2014 and 2015: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>2014 Changes </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Lengthened the vesting period and modified the performance period for PSUs.</I></B> The Compensation Committee lengthened the vesting period for PSUs
from 24 months to 36 months and used a two-year adjusted operating earnings per share compound annual growth goal established at the start of the performance period
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>

<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>29</B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left" COLOR="#000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
(changed from two one-year goals). This change responded to shareholder requests for a longer-term program. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Replaced MSUs with SARs for senior executives.</I></B> For the Company&#146;s most senior executives, the Compensation Committee replaced the MSU
portion of the long-term incentive equity program (previously 70% of the value of the long-term award) with SARs. Because SARs have a 10-year term and only have value if the stock price rises after the grant date, this change supports the
Company&#146;s long-term strategic focus to drive change in the health care industry and to create long-term shareholder value. These awards vest in three substantially equal annual installments. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Updated the Health Care Comparison Group.</I></B> For 2014 pay decisions, the Compensation Committee replaced the 2013 Health Care Comparison Group
with the 2014 Health Care Comparison Group described on
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
page 38 (the &#147;2014 Health Care Comparison Group&#148;). This revision to the Health Care Comparison Group was prompted by the acquisition of Coventry and includes health care companies with
revenues ranging from .5x to 2x our projected 2014 revenue. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>2015 Changes </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Lengthened PSU performance goal.</I></B> The Compensation Committee further lengthened the performance period for PSUs granted in 2015 from 24 months
to 36 months. The performance period for the PSUs now aligns with the vesting period and completes the transition of the long-term incentive program from one that supported shorter-term goals during the uncertainty facing the Company at the outset
of health care reform, to a longer-term program supporting the Company&#146;s longer-term strategy and implementation of our long-term strategic plan.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:13pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">II.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" STYLE="font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><B>Objectives of Our Executive Compensation Program </B></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">An understanding of our executive compensation program begins with the program objectives. Although we
have made changes to our program in recent years, our objectives remain the same. These include: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Aligning the interests of our executives and shareholders.</I></B>&nbsp;We align the interests of our executives with those of our shareholders through
equity-based compensation that is settled in shares of Common Stock and executive share ownership and share retention requirements. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Linking rewards to performance.</I></B>&nbsp;We implement a pay-for-performance philosophy by tying a significant portion of our executives&#146;
compensation to the achievement of financial and other goals that are linked to the Company&#146;s
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
business strategy and each executive&#146;s contributions towards the achievement of those goals. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Offering competitive compensation.</I></B>&nbsp;We offer an executive compensation program that is competitive and that helps us attract, motivate and
retain top performing executives in the highly competitive global market for health care talent. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">We continue to believe that a
significant portion of executive compensation should be variable and based on stock price change and meeting or exceeding defined performance goals (i.e., &#147;at risk&#148;). Our program meets this goal by delivering compensation in the form of
equity and other performance-based awards. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The chart below shows the 2014 mix
of target compensation opportunity for Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini and for the other NEOs as a group. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g864659g04o01.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Below is a summary of the Compensation Committee&#146;s compensation decisions for Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>2014 Compensation Opportunity </I></B> </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#150;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s 2014 total direct compensation opportunity ($13.9 million at target) was just over the 50<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">th</SUP> percentile of the average of the comparison groups we use to assess our compensation. (The 2014 Health Care Comparison Group and the 2014 Cross-Industry Comparison Group are listed on page 38.
Together, these groups are referred to as the &#147;Comparison Groups&#148;). Within the total direct compensation opportunity, Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s 2014 annual bonus target was set at 300% of his annual base salary. Of this amount, 60% is paid
in RSUs which are tied directly to the value of Aetna shares and which vest over three years. The Compensation Committee recognizes that Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s annual bonus opportunity is high compared to the annual bonus target of his peers in
the Comparison Groups when viewed in isolation. However, when this bonus opportunity was first established on his appointment as CEO, there was a corresponding reduction to Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s annual long-term incentive equity grant value to
keep his total compensation levels at an appropriate market level. This change in mix of pay opportunity, coupled with the additional vesting required for the equity portion of the award, was made to more directly align Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s
total direct compensation opportunity with the Company&#146;s annual financial performance, while continuing the focus on creation of long-term shareholder value and retention. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#150;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s 2014 long-term incentive opportunity was set at $9.9 million. This grant was delivered 70% in SARs ($6.9 million) and 30% in PSUs
($3.0 million). The SARs and PSUs granted in 2014 are described on page 34. The SARs vest in three equal annual installments beginning March 3, 2015, and the PSUs will vest in 2017, in each case, subject to Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s continued
employment and, with respect to PSUs, Company performance.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Compensation Decisions for 2014</I></B> </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#150;<B><I></I></B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Base Salary. </I></B>Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s salary has not been adjusted since his appointment as CEO in November 2010. The Compensation Committee
has not made a change to Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s base salary due to the Company&#146;s compensation philosophy of focusing on variable pay that rewards performance and long term success. Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s annual base salary is the<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"></SUP> lowest of the CEOs in the 2014 Health Care Comparison Group. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#150;<B><I></I></B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Annual Bonus.</I></B> Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s annual bonus for 2014 was determined primarily on the basis of the Company&#146;s strong financial
performance against the ABP goals described in detail beginning on page 33 and paid out at 140% of target. In addition, the Compensation Committee and the Board considered that in 2014 the Company&#146;s total return to shareholders was 31% and that
the Company&#146;s three-year cumulative total return to shareholders was nearly 120%. The Compensation Committee and the Board also conducted a review of Mr. Bertolini&#146;s qualitative performance. The individual qualitative performance factors
considered consisted primarily of execution of strategy (including continuing the transformation of the Company&#146;s business model, and refinement of the Company&#146;s long-term strategic vision), business results (including strong growth of the
Company&#146;s Government businesses) and leadership. Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini continues to be a recognized thought leader who serves as a positive and constructive influence on not only the implementation of health care reform and the related
transformation of the health care system, but also on important social policy issues affecting the Company and our nation (including &#147;fix-the-debt&#148; and employee wages). Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini has built effective relationships with investors,
thought leaders and other constituents across the health care industry. In 2014, he was again recognized as one of the top 10 most influential persons in health care. Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini has built a strong leadership
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>31</B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="20">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
team which, under his direction, is driving the business and executing the Company&#146;s strategy, while focusing on the Company&#146;s long-term success. The annual bonus for 2014 was paid 40%
in cash and 60% in a grant of RSUs that will vest over a 36-month period.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt"><B><I>Long-Term Incentive Awards.</I></B>&nbsp;The Compensation Committee determined that the performance target set for the second performance period of the
PSUs granted in 2013 had been met. In addition, the Committee determined that the Company exceeded both the revenue and operating income measures for the MSUs granted in 2012.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:13pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">IV.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" STYLE="font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><B>2014 Compensation Policies </B></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I></I><B><I>What are the elements of the Company&#146;s executive compensation program? </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The 2014 compensation program for our Named Executive Officers consisted of the following components: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="34%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="29%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Component</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Description</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Purpose</B></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">Base Salary</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">Fixed cash compensation based on the executive&#146;s past and potential future performance, scope of responsibilities, experience and competitive market pay practices.</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">Provide a fixed, baseline level of compensation that is not contingent upon Company performance.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top">Performance-Based Annual Bonus</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Cash payment tied to meeting annual performance goals set for the fiscal year that are tied to the Company&#146;s annual business plan and individual performance.</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Motivate executives to achieve superior annual financial and operational performance.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">Long-Term Equity Incentives:<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top">PSUs</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Performance-based stock units which pay out, if at all, based on the Company&#146;s performance against a two-year adjusted operating earnings per share compound annual growth financial goal. If the goal is met, the PSUs granted in
2014 will vest in a single installment at the end of a 36-month vesting period as described on page 34.</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Align achievement of specific multi-year internal financial performance objective with the creation of shareholder value, increase executive stock ownership and provide retention incentives.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">RSUs</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">Time-vested stock units that vest over the time period set at grant, typically 36 months.</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">Align compensation with changes in Company stock price and the creation of shareholder value, and strengthen retention.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">SARs</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">Stock appreciation rights that vest in substantially equal annual installments over 36 months.</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL">Align compensation with changes in</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL">Company stock price and creation of shareholder value.</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="0%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>(1)</I></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" >&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>All awards are settled in stock and are subject to stock ownership requirements. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Company also provides health, welfare and retirement benefits to its executives and other employees generally. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I></I><B><I>How are the total cash and equity compensation amounts determined? </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Our compensation program is generally designed to set total cash and equity compensation opportunity (considered as base salary, performance-based annual
bonus and long-term incentive equity awards) for senior executives at an amount that is competitively reasonable and appropriate for our business needs and circumstances. For the Named Executive Officers, the Compensation Committee reviews the cash
and equity compensation opportunities available to similarly positioned executives of companies in the Comparison Groups. The Compensation Committee also reviews third-party compensation surveys. The companies that make up each Comparison Group and
the reasons they were selected are listed on page 38. The third-party compensation surveys are purchased from outside compensation vendors selected by our human resources department, and the data provided by the vendors is
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
reviewed by the Compensation Committee&#146;s independent compensation consultant. The data presented to the Compensation Committee includes a regression analysis (market compensation data
adjusted to account for company size based on revenue) where available. The compensation of our Named Executive Officers is compared across the Named Executive Officer group and with the compensation of other senior executives of the Company for
internal pay relativity purposes. The Compensation Committee, however, has not established a specific pay relativity percentage. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Our compensation
program is generally designed to deliver above-median total compensation for <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">above-median</FONT> performance and below-median total compensation for below-median performance. For executives with compensation
opportunities that are more highly variable, including the Named Executive Officers, total cash and equity compensation opportunity may be above the
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>32</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
median, but &#147;at risk&#148; amounts are paid only if performance goals are achieved or exceeded. In addition, the value of the equity awards is directly subject to stock price change. In
setting total compensation opportunity, the Compensation Committee does not, on a formulaic basis, set target compensation opportunity at the precise median of the Comparison Groups. Instead, the Compensation Committee uses Comparison Group
information as a reference point to make what is ultimately a subjective decision that balances (i)&nbsp;a competitive level of compensation for a position; (ii)&nbsp;executive experience and scope of responsibility; (iii)&nbsp;individual
performance; (iv)&nbsp;percent of pay &#147;at risk&#148;; and (v)&nbsp;retention. There is no pre-defined formula that determines which of these factors is more or less important, and the emphasis placed on a specific factor may vary among
executive officers and will reflect market conditions and business needs at the time the pay decision is made. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I></I><B><I>How are base salaries for executive
officers determined? </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In making annual base salary determinations, the Compensation Committee considers: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">the terms of any employment agreement with the executive; </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">the recommendations of our CEO (as to executives other than himself); </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">the salary paid to persons in comparable positions in the Comparison Groups; </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">the executive&#146;s experience and scope of responsibility; and </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">a subjective assessment of the executive&#146;s individual past and potential future contribution to Company results. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Base salary, as a percent of total compensation, also differs based on the executive&#146;s position and function. Although the Compensation Committee
has not established a
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
specific ratio of base salary to total compensation, in general, executives with the highest level and broadest scope of responsibility have the lowest percentage of their compensation fixed as
salary and have the highest percentage of their compensation subject to performance-based standards (performance-based annual bonus and long-term incentives). None of the Named Executive Officers received a base salary increase for 2014 as their
base salary levels were deemed appropriate in the context of their total direct compensation. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I></I><B><I>How are annual performance-based bonuses determined?
</I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Except for a portion of Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s bonus (described on page 32), the 2014 annual bonuses were paid in cash. All executive
officers and managers are eligible to participate in the ABP. The Compensation Committee, after consulting with the Board, establishes specific financial and operational goals at the beginning of each performance year. Annual bonus funding is linked
directly to the achievement of these annual goals. Following the completion of the performance year, the Compensation Committee assesses performance against the pre-established performance goals to determine bonus funding for the year. The ABP
goals, described in more detail below, are directly derived from our strategic and business operating plan approved by the Board. These goals, which measure annual results, were selected to balance the delivery of financial results with the
achievement of internal and external constituent goals. The Company believes it is important to consider these non-financial constituent goals, which for 2014 have a 20% ABP weighting, because they help keep a focus on our longer-term success and
the quality of our brand and reputation, rather than purely annual financial results. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under the ABP, if all of the goals are met at the target level
in the aggregate, then up to 100% of the target bonus pool is funded. If the goals are exceeded in the aggregate, by a sufficient margin, then up to a maximum of 200% of the target bonus pool is funded. At the threshold performance level, 25% of the
target bonus pool is funded. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">For 2014, bonus pool funding under
the ABP was determined as set forth below: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD></TD>

<TD></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">76.2</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="top">&nbsp;&nbsp;10%</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
