<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_35"></A>Deferred Compensation Narrative </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The &#147;Salary&#148; and &#147;Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation&#148; columns in the 2014 Summary
Compensation Table include cash compensation that was deferred by the Named Executive Officers during 2014. The Company permits executives to defer up to 40% of eligible pay (which includes base salary and annual bonus) into the Aetna 401(k) Plan
(subject to deferral limits established by the Code &#151; in 2014, $17,500 ($23,000 for individuals age 50 and older)). The Aetna 401(k) Plan, which is available to all eligible employees of the Company, is a funded arrangement that provides
nineteen investment options, as well as a self-directed brokerage option. Aetna matches 100% of the amount deferred by employees, including the Named Executive Officers, under the Aetna 401(k) Plan up to 6% of eligible pay. Under the Aetna 401(k)
Plan, benefits are paid to the employee (including NEOs) after termination of employment on the date selected by the employee. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna established the
Supplemental 401(k) Plan to provide the deferral that would have been credited to the Aetna 401(k) Plan but for limits imposed by the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, and the Code. The Supplemental 401(k) Plan allows
eligible employees, including the Named Executive Officers, to defer up to an additional 10% of base salary. Aetna does not match employees&#146; contributions to the Supplemental 401(k) Plan. The Supplemental 401(k) Plan is an unfunded
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
plan that credits interest at a fixed rate pursuant to a formula equal to the rate of interest paid from time to time under the fixed interest rate fund option of the Aetna 401(k) Plan. The Aetna
401(k) Plan interest rate is set quarterly to better align the credited rates with the underlying fixed income investment earning rates achieved in the fund. In 2014, this fixed interest rate was 1.90% from January to March, 1.95% from April to June
and 2.05% from July to September and from October to December. In 2015, this fixed interest rate is 2.20% from January to March. Under the Supplemental 401(k) Plan, benefits are paid to the executive on the later of six months or January&nbsp;1
following termination of employment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Company also permits executives to defer up to 100% of their annual bonus. The deferral arrangement for
annual bonuses is also unfunded and permits investment in either an interest account or a stock unit account. The interest account credits interest at the same rate as the Supplemental 401(k) Plan. The stock unit account tracks the value of the
Common Stock. The stock unit account earns dividend equivalents, paid in the manner of the </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">individual&#146;s selection. This arrangement pays out on
a date selected by the executive at the time of deferral. The Compensation Committee may also require or permit other compensation to be deferred.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_36"></A>Potential
Post-Employment Payments </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Regardless of the manner in which a Named Executive Officer&#146;s employment terminates, he or she is
entitled to receive certain amounts earned during his or her term of employment, including the following: (a)&nbsp;deferred compensation amounts; (b)&nbsp;amounts accrued and vested through the Aetna 401(k) Plan and Supplemental 401(k) Plan; and
(c)&nbsp;amounts accrued and vested through the Pension Plan and Supplemental Pension Plan. In addition, except as provided in the tables below, each Named Executive Officer is eligible to receive vested equity awards upon a termination of
employment for any reason (other than for cause). Equity awards (other than PSUs and MSUs) continue to vest for all employees during any period of severance or salary continuation. The actual amounts paid to any Named Executive Officer can only be
determined at the time of the executive&#146;s separation from the Company. Section&nbsp;409A of the Code may require the Company to delay the payment of certain payments for six months following termination of employment. Refer to the 2014
Nonqualified Deferred Compensation table and &#147;Deferred Compensation Narrative&#148; beginning on page 46 for a discussion of the deferred compensation plan, Aetna 401(k) Plan and Supplemental 401(k) Plan. Refer to the 2014 Pension Benefits
table and &#147;Pension Plan Narrative&#148;
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
beginning on page 44 for a discussion of the Pension Plan and Supplemental Pension Plan. Refer to the Outstanding Equity Awards at 2014 Fiscal Year-End table beginning on page 41 for a discussion
of outstanding equity awards at December&nbsp;31, 2014. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Our agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky provides that the Company will make him whole for
certain excise taxes that may apply under Sections 280G and 4999 of the Code for payments made in connection with a change in control. SEC regulations require an estimate of these amounts, for purposes of the following tables, assuming that the
change in control and termination of employment occurred on December&nbsp;31, 2014, and using the market price of the Common Stock on that day. Using these assumed facts, these provisions produce no hypothetical payment to Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky. Any
payments that may actually be owed to Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky under these provisions will be highly dependent upon the actual facts applicable to the change in control transaction and termination of employment, and can be accurately estimated only when
such facts are known. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Unless otherwise indicated, each of the tables for the Named Executive Officers below assumes a termination of employment (or
change in control and termination of </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>47</B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
employment without Cause and/or for Good Reason, as defined below, as applicable) as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, and assumes a Common Stock price of $88.83 per share (the closing price of the
Common Stock on December&nbsp;31, 2014) and, for illustrative purposes, an immediate sale of equity awards upon termination of employment at $88.83 per share. Change in control severance benefits (base salary and bonus payments) to each Named
Executive Officer are paid pursuant to a &#147;double-trigger,&#148; which means that to receive such benefits employment must terminate both: (1)&nbsp;as a result of a qualifying termination of employment, and (2)&nbsp;after a change in control as
detailed in the agreements described below and under &#147;Agreements with Named Executive Officers&#148; beginning on page 52. Unless otherwise indicated, the amounts set forth in the tables that follow under &#147;PSUs&#148; were calculated based
upon the Compensation Committee&#146;s determination that the Company achieved above target performance of 127.08% for performance Period One for the applicable PSUs granted in 2013 and above target performance of 131.62% for performance Period Two
for those PSUs. For &#147;Termination after Change-in-Control,&#148; PSUs granted in 2013 are assumed to vest at actual performance for both performance Period One and performance Period Two. The PSUs granted in 2014 are assumed to vest at target
performance both in the case of a change in control and in the case of certain qualified terminations (pro-rated for the number of months employed during the vesting period). The
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
performance metric for these PSUs is a compound annual growth rate goal of 2015 adjusted operating earnings per share over 2013 adjusted operating earnings per share. If performance were
calculated at December&nbsp;31, 2014, these PSUs would perform below target. Actual performance of and payouts of these PSUs may change significantly by December&nbsp;31, 2015. Refer to footnote 3 to the 2014 Summary Compensation Table for
information on the grant date fair value of the PSUs granted in 2014 at maximum performance. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The NEOs&#146; equity award agreements define
&#147;Change in Control&#148; as the occurrence of any of the following events: (a)&nbsp;a person or group acquires 20% or more of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then outstanding securities; (b)&nbsp;during any period of 24
consecutive months, the individuals who, at the beginning of such period, constitute the Board cease for any reason (other than death) to constitute a majority of the Board, unless any such new Director was elected, recommended or approved by at
least two-thirds of the other Directors then in office; or (c)&nbsp;a transaction requiring shareholder approval for the acquisition of the Company by an entity other than the Company or a subsidiary of the Company through the purchase of assets, or
by merger, or otherwise. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, Messrs. Bertolini and Zubretsky and Ms.&nbsp;McCarthy were considered retirement eligible for
purposes of equity vesting. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Mark T. Bertolini </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The following table reflects additional payments that would be made to Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini upon termination
of his employment on December&nbsp;31, 2014, under various scenarios. Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s employment agreement defines &#147;Cause&#148; as the occurrence of one or more of the following: (a)&nbsp;a willful and continued failure to attempt in
good faith to perform duties, which failure is not remedied within fifteen business days following written notice of such failure; (b)&nbsp;material gross negligence or willful malfeasance in performance of duties; (c)&nbsp;with respect to the
Company, commission of an act constituting fraud, embezzlement or any other act constituting a felony; or (d)&nbsp;commission of any act constituting a felony which has or is likely to have a material adverse economic or reputational impact on the
Company. Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s employment agreement defines &#147;Good Reason&#148; as the occurrence of one or more of the following without Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s consent : (a)&nbsp;a reduction by the Company of base salary or target cash
bonus opportunity (except in the event of a ratable reduction prior
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
to a change in control affecting all senior officers of the Company); (b)&nbsp;within 24 months following a change of control, a reduction in the level of the long-term incentive plan opportunity
from that afforded him immediately prior to the change in control; (c)&nbsp;any failure of a successor of the Company to assume and agree to perform the Company&#146;s entire obligations under the employment agreement; (d)&nbsp;reporting to any
person other than the Company&#146;s Board of Directors; (e)&nbsp;any action or inaction by the Company that constitutes a material breach of the employment agreement; (f)&nbsp;removal of Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini as President, Chief Executive Officer or
Director; or (g)&nbsp;the appointment of any person to the position of executive Chairman. Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s employment agreement contains a change in control cutback policy which, under certain circumstances, would reduce the amount due to
Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini following a change in control to an amount that maximizes the net after tax amount retained by him to the extent permitted under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">

would occur following February&nbsp;2, 2015. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;1, 2013 would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2016. Payment would occur in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes, based on the average closing price of the
Common Stock for the respective final 30 trading day periods ending on the February&nbsp;2, 2015 and February&nbsp;1, 2016 vesting dates, each of which is assumed to be $88.83. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

grants. Actual payment of the August 2013 PSU grant would occur following January&nbsp;5, 2016 in stock units, net of taxes, into an unfunded deferred stock unit account which will not be paid to Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini until 6 months following his
termination of employment with the Company. PSU grants awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014 and August&nbsp;5, 2013 are assumed to perform at target. Actual payouts for PSU grants may differ from target. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(13)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full accelerated vesting of all outstanding unvested RSU, MSU, PSU, and SAR awards, except for PSU grant awarded August&nbsp;5, 2013, which
represents continued vesting and actual payment would occur on January&nbsp;5, 2016. PSU grant awarded August&nbsp;5, 2013 is assumed to vest at target. PSUs would vest at the greater of target or actual Company performance as of the date of the
Change in Control (as defined in Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s equity award agreements). MSU value assumes the average closing price of the Common Stock for the final 30 trading days of each of the applicable vesting periods is $88.83.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(14)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Unvested PSARs, RSUs, MSUs, PSUs and SARs are subject to forfeiture if there is a termination by Aetna for Cause (as defined in Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s
employment agreement). </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(15)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full accelerated vesting at target of PSAR grant awarded August&nbsp;5, 2013. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(16)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full accelerated vesting of RSU grants awarded February&nbsp;2, 2012,&nbsp;February&nbsp;1, 2013, and March&nbsp;3, 2014.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(17)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full vesting of MSU grants awarded February&nbsp;2, 2012 and February&nbsp;1, 2013. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;2, 2012 would
occur following February&nbsp;2, 2015. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;1, 2013 would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2016. Payment would occur in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes, based on the average closing price of the Common
Stock for the respective final 30 trading day periods ending on the February&nbsp;2, 2015 and February&nbsp;1, 2016 vesting dates, each of which is assumed to be $88.83. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(18)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full vesting of PSU grants awarded February&nbsp;1, 2013 and March&nbsp;3, 2014. Actual payment would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2015 and
March&nbsp;3, 2017, respectively, in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes. Represents full accelerated vesting of PSU grant awarded August&nbsp;5, 2013; actual payment would occur following January&nbsp;5, 2016 in stock units, net of taxes, into an
unfunded deferred stock unit account which will not be paid to Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini or his estate until 6 months following his termination of employment with the Company. PSU grant awarded August&nbsp;5, 2013 would vest at target. PSU grant awarded
March&nbsp;3, 2014 is assumed to perform at target. Actual payout may differ from target. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Shawn M. Guertin </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>

under various scenarios. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></TD></TR>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(1)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents 52 weeks of base salary continuation. Amounts would be paid bi-weekly during the severance period. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(2)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents pro-rated vesting of MSU grants awarded February&nbsp;2, 2012,&nbsp;March&nbsp;12, 2012 and February&nbsp;1, 2013. Actual payment for MSUs
granted February&nbsp;2, 2012 would occur following February&nbsp;2, 2015. Actual payment for MSUs granted March&nbsp;12, 2012 would occur following March&nbsp;12, 2015. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;1, 2013 would occur following
February&nbsp;1, 2016. Payment would occur in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes, based on the average closing price of the Common Stock for the respective final 30 trading day periods ending on the February&nbsp;2, 2015,&nbsp;March&nbsp;12, 2015
and February&nbsp;1, 2016 vesting dates, each of which is assumed to be $88.83. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(3)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full vesting of PSU grants awarded February&nbsp;1, 2013 subject to performance Period One and performance Period Two and pro-rated vesting of
PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014. Actual payment would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2015 and March&nbsp;3, 2017, respectively, in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes. PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014 is assumed to perform at target.
Actual payout may differ from target. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(4)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents partial vesting of SAR grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014. These SARs have an exercise price of $72.26, the closing price of the Common Stock on
the grant date. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(5)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full accelerated vesting of all outstanding unvested equity awards. PSUs would vest at the greater of target or actual Company performance as of
the date of the Change in Control (as defined in Mr.&nbsp;Guertin&#146;s equity award agreements). MSU value assumes the average closing price of the Common Stock for the final 30 trading days of each of the applicable vesting periods is $88.83.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(6)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Unvested MSUs, PSUs, and SARs are subject to forfeiture if there is a termination by Aetna for cause. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(7)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full accelerated vesting of SAR grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Margaret M. McCarthy </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>

under various scenarios. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(1)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents 42 weeks of base salary continuation. Amounts would be paid bi-weekly during the severance period. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(2)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents pro-rated vesting of MSU grants awarded February&nbsp;2, 2012 and February&nbsp;1, 2013. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;2, 2012
would occur following February&nbsp;2, 2015. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;1, 2013 would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2016. Payment would occur in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes, based on the average closing price of the
Common Stock for the respective final 30 trading day periods ending on the&nbsp;February&nbsp;2, 2015 and February&nbsp;1, 2016 vesting dates, each of which is assumed to be $88.83. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014. Actual payment would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2015 and March&nbsp;3, 2017, respectively, in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes. PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014 is assumed to perform at target.
Actual payout may differ from target. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

the grant date. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

the date of the Change in Control (as defined in Ms.&nbsp;McCarthy&#146;s equity award agreements). MSU value assumes the average closing price of the Common Stock for the final 30 trading days of each of the applicable vesting periods is $88.83.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(1)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents 26 weeks of base salary continuation. Amounts would be paid bi-weekly during the severance period. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(2)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents pro-rated vesting of MSU grants awarded February&nbsp;1, 2013 and August&nbsp;12, 2013. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;1, 2013
would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2016. Actual payment for MSUs granted August&nbsp;12, 2013 would occur following August&nbsp;12, 2016. Payment would occur in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes, based on the average closing price of the
Common Stock for the respective final 30 trading day periods ending on the&nbsp;February&nbsp;1, 2016 and August&nbsp;12, 2016 vesting dates, each of which is assumed to be $88.83. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(3)</I></TD>

February&nbsp;1, 2013 subject performance Period Two, pro-rated vesting of PSU grant awarded August&nbsp;12, 2013 subject to performance Period One, full vesting of PSU grant awarded August&nbsp;12, 2013 subject performance Period Two and pro-rated
vesting of PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014. Actual payment would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2015,&nbsp;August&nbsp;12, 2015 and March&nbsp;3, 2017, respectively, in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes. PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3,
2014 is assumed to perform at target. Actual payout may differ from target. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

the grant date. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

the date of the Change in Control (as defined in Mr.&nbsp;Soistman&#146;s equity award agreements). MSU value assumes the average closing price of the Common Stock for the final 30 trading days of each of the applicable vesting periods is $88.83.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Joseph M. Zubretsky </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The following table reflects additional payments that would be made to Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky upon termination
of his employment on December&nbsp;31, 2014, under various scenarios. Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky&#146;s agreement defines &#147;Cause&#148; as the occurrence of one or more of the following: (a)&nbsp;a willful and continued failure to attempt in good faith
to perform duties, which failure is not remedied within 15 business days following notice of such failure; (b)&nbsp;material gross negligence or willful malfeasance in performance of duties; (c)&nbsp;with
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
respect to the Company, a conviction for fraud, embezzlement or any other felony; or (d)&nbsp;a conviction of a felony which has or is likely to have a material adverse economic or reputational
impact on the Company. Under Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky&#146;s agreement, &#147;Change in Control&#148; means the occurrence or the expected occurrence of a change in &#147;the ownership or effective control&#148; of Aetna or &#147;the ownership of a
substantial portion of the assets&#148; of Aetna within the meaning of Section&nbsp;280G of the Code. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

would occur following February&nbsp;2, 2015. Actual payment for MSUs granted February&nbsp;1, 2013 would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2016. Payment would occur in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes, based on the average closing price of the
Common Stock for the respective final 30 trading day periods ending on the&nbsp;February&nbsp;2, 2015 and February&nbsp;1, 2016 vesting dates, each of which is assumed to be $88.83. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(3)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full vesting of PSU grants awarded February&nbsp;1, 2013 subject to performance Period One and performance Period Two and pro-rated vesting of
PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014. Actual payment would occur following February&nbsp;1, 2015 and March&nbsp;3, 2017, respectively, in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes. PSU grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014 is assumed to perform at target.
Actual payout may differ from target. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(4)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents partial vesting of SAR grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014.These SARs have an exercise price of $72.26, the closing price of the Common Stock on
the grant date. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(5)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full accelerated vesting of all outstanding unvested equity awards. PSUs would vest at the greater of target or actual Company performance as of
the date of the Change in Control (as defined in Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky&#146;s equity award agreements). MSU value assumes the average closing price of the Common Stock for the final 30 trading days of each of the applicable vesting periods is $88.83.
</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

</I></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><I>&nbsp;(7)</I></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt"><I>Represents full accelerated vesting of SAR grant awarded March&nbsp;3, 2014. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_52"></A>Agreements with Named Executive Officers </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna and Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini amended his amended and restated employment agreement effective
August&nbsp;4, 2013. The amendment extended the remaining term of the agreement to December&nbsp;31, 2016, with automatic one-year extensions. Under his agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini is entitled to an annual salary of $1,000,000, and a full year
target bonus opportunity of at least 300% of his base salary. Not greater than 40% of his bonus opportunity is payable in cash, and the noncash amount is payable through equity-based compensation vehicles. If Aetna terminates
Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s employment other than for &#147;Cause&#148; (as defined in the agreement), death or disability, or Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini terminates his employment for &#147;Good Reason&#148; (as defined in the agreement), he will be entitled
to 24 months of cash compensation (calculated as annual base salary and target cash bonus opportunity) plus a pro rata portion of his target cash bonus opportunity for the year of termination. Under certain circumstances the amounts payable to
Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini following a change in control will be reduced to an amount that maximizes the net after tax amount retained by him to the extent permitted under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. Under the non-competition agreement entered into in
July 2007 between Aetna and Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini, Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini agreed not to compete against the Company for a period of one year following termination of his employment. The applicable table above under &#147;Potential Post-Employment
Payments&#148; reflects the provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Bertolini&#146;s agreements with the Company. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under his letter agreement with the Company,
Mr.&nbsp;Guertin was hired with an annual base salary of $500,000 and a target bonus opportunity of 80% of his base salary. Mr.&nbsp;Guertin&#146;s base salary was increased to $700,000 and his target bonus opportunity was increased to 100% of his
base salary upon his promotion to Chief Financial Officer. If Mr.&nbsp;Guertin&#146;s employment is involuntarily terminated under circumstances that would call for severance pay benefits and/or salary continuation benefits under the Company&#146;s
severance and salary continuation plan then in effect, Mr.&nbsp;Guertin will receive payment for 52 weeks of salary continuation in lieu of amounts payable under such severance and salary continuation benefits plan. Under his agreement,
Mr.&nbsp;Guertin is eligible for Aetna&#146;s Key Executive relocation assistance. Under the non-competition agreement entered into in March 2011 between Aetna and Mr.&nbsp;Guertin, Mr.&nbsp;Guertin agreed not to compete against the Company for a
period of one year following termination of
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
his employment. The applicable table above under &#147;Potential Post-Employment Payments&#148; reflects the provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Guertin&#146;s agreements with the Company. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In connection with her 2010 retention RSU award, Ms.&nbsp;McCarthy has agreed not to compete against the Company for a period of one year following
termination of her employment. The applicable table above under &#147;Potential Post-Employment Payments&#148; reflects the provisions of Ms.&nbsp;McCarthy&#146;s agreements with the Company. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under his letter agreement with the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Soistman was hired with an annual base salary of $500,000 and a target bonus opportunity of 80% of
his base salary. Mr.&nbsp;Soistman&#146;s base salary was increased to $600,000 and his target bonus opportunity was increased to 100% of his base salary upon his promotion to Executive Vice President, Government Services. Under the non-competition
agreement entered into in December 2012 between Aetna and Mr.&nbsp;Soistman, Mr.&nbsp;Soistman agreed not to compete against the Company for a period of one year following termination of his employment. The applicable table above under
&#147;Potential Post-Employment Payments&#148; reflects the provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Soistman&#146;s agreements with the Company. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:5pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna entered into
an agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky at the time of his hire in February of 2007, which was last amended effective December&nbsp;17, 2008. The agreement provided for an annual salary of $700,000 and a full year target bonus opportunity of 100% of
base salary. Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky&#146;s base salary was increased to $850,000 effective as of April&nbsp;8, 2013, and his target bonus opportunity was increased to 110% of base salary effective for performance year 2011. If Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky&#146;s
employment is involuntarily terminated by the Company other than for &#147;Cause&#148; (as defined in the agreement), his severance payment would be 12 months of base salary plus bonus at target. Aetna has agreed generally to make Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky
whole for certain excise taxes incurred as a result of payments made under his agreement or otherwise, although under certain circumstances Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky has agreed to reduce the amounts payable to him to an amount that does not trigger any
such excise taxes. Under the non-competition agreement entered into in February 2007 between Aetna and Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky, Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky has agreed not to compete against the Company for a period of
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>52</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
one year following termination of his employment. The applicable table above under &#147;Potential Post-Employment
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Payments&#148; reflects the provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Zubretsky&#146;s agreements with the Company.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_53"></A>Job Elimination
Benefits Plan </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna administers a Job Elimination Benefits Plan under which eligible employees, including Aetna&#146;s
executive officers, terminated by Aetna due to re-engineering, reorganization or staff reduction efforts may receive a maximum of 52 weeks of continuing salary depending on years of service and pay level. Under certain circumstances, determined on a
case-by-case basis, additional severance pay benefits may be granted for the purpose of inducing employment of senior officers or rewarding past service. The tables above under &#147;Potential Post-Employment Payments&#148; reflect any benefits
payable under the Job Elimination Benefits Plan to the extent NEOs are not entitled to severance under individual agreements. Certain health and other employee benefits continue for part of the severance period. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board has approved provisions for certain benefits of eligible Company employees upon a change in control of Aetna (as defined). The provisions
provide that the Job
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Elimination Benefits Plan shall provide an enhanced benefit and shall become noncancelable for a period of two years following a change in control. Upon a change in control, stock options and
other equity-based awards granted prior to January&nbsp;1, 2010 and PSUs and MSUs granted on or after January&nbsp;1, 2010 that have not yet vested will become vested and immediately exercisable, PSARs granted after January&nbsp;1, 2013 that have
not yet vested will continue to vest in accordance with the original terms of the grant, and bonuses payable under the Annual Incentive Plan will become payable based on the target award for participants. Upon a change in control, stock options,
SARs and RSUs granted on or after January&nbsp;1, 2010 vest upon a termination of employment by the Company other than for cause within 24 months after the change in control. Provision also has been made to maintain the aggregate value of specified
benefits for one year following a change in control. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><A NAME="toc864659_37"></A>Equity Compensation
Plans </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The following table gives information about Common Stock that may be issued upon the exercise of options,
SARs, PSARs, warrants and rights and any other outstanding awards under all of our equity compensation plans as of December&nbsp;31, 2014. In 2014, our most senior executives&#146; annual equity-based incentive compensation value was granted 50% in
SARs and 50% in PSUs; all other
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
executives&#146; equity-based incentive compensation value was granted 50% in PSUs and 50% in MSUs. PSUs and MSUs are delivered in shares, net of taxes, after final performance is reviewed and
approved and the awards have vested. SARs are settled in shares of Common Stock, net of taxes, when exercised. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

issuance under the 2010 Director Plan; and 4,456,663 shares of Common Stock available for future issuance under the 2011 ESPP. Shares available under the 2010 Stock Plan and the 2010 Director Plan may become the subject of future awards in the form
of stock options, SARs, PSARs, restricted stock, RSUs, PSUs, MSUs and other stock-based awards. Only shares of Common Stock are issuable under the 2011 ESPP. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, employees had committed an aggregate of approximately $15.7
million to purchase Common Stock under the 2011 ESPP. This purchase will occur on June&nbsp;5, 2015, at a purchase price equal to 95% of the fair market value of the Common Stock on the purchase date. </I></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION </B></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>2002 Stock Incentive Plan </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Aetna Inc. 2002 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;Prior Stock Plan&#148;) was replaced by the 2010 Stock
Plan. The Prior Stock Plan was designed to promote our interests and those of our shareholders and to further align the interests of shareholders and employees by tying awards to total return to shareholders, enabling plan participants to acquire
additional equity interests in Aetna and providing compensation opportunities dependent upon our performance. The Prior Stock Plan expired on January&nbsp;25, 2012, and was not submitted to shareholders for approval. No shares of Common Stock remain
available for future awards under the Prior Stock Plan. </P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under the Prior Stock Plan, eligible participants formerly could be granted stock options to purchase
shares of Common Stock, SARs, time vesting and/or performance vesting incentive stock or incentive units and other stock-based awards. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the maximum number of shares of Common Stock that may be issued under the awards
outstanding under the Prior Stock Plan was 207,938 shares, subject to adjustment for corporate transactions, and no shares remained available for future awards. If an award under the Prior Stock Plan is paid solely in cash, no shares are deducted
from the number of shares available for issuance. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>2000 Non-Employee Director Compensation Plan
</B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Aetna Inc. 2000 Non-Employee Director Plan (the &#147;Prior Director Plan&#148;) was replaced by the
Aetna Inc. 2010 Director Plan. The Prior Director Plan permitted Aetna&#146;s eligible Directors to receive shares of Common Stock, deferred stock units, RSUs and other stock-based awards in recognition of their contributions. The Prior Director
Plan expired on April&nbsp;30, 2010, and was not submitted to shareholders for approval. No shares of Common Stock
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
remain available for future awards under the Prior Director Plan. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the maximum number of shares of Common Stock that may be issued under the awards outstanding under the
Prior Director Plan was 364,746 shares, subject to adjustment for corporate transactions, and no shares remained available for future awards.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>54</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:22pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_38"></A>COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REPORT </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:30pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board has determined in its business judgment that all members of the Compensation Committee meet the
independence requirements set forth in the NYSE listing standards and in Aetna&#146;s Director Independence Standards. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Committee operates
pursuant to a Charter that was last reviewed by the Committee on November&nbsp;20, 2014. The Compensation Committee Charter can be found at <B>www.aetna.com/investors-aetna/governance/committees.html.</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed the Company&#146;s Compensation Discussion and Analysis included in this Proxy Statement with
management. Based
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
on this review and discussion, the Committee has recommended to the Board that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this Proxy Statement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>The Committee on Compensation and Talent Management </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Roger N. Farah, <I>Chair
</I> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Frank M. Clark </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Barbara Hackman Franklin </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Jeffrey E. Garten </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Edward J. Ludwig
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:22pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_39"></A>REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:30pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Board has determined in its business judgment that all members of the Audit Committee meet the
independence, financial literacy and expertise requirements for audit committee members set forth in the NYSE listing standards. Additionally, the Board has determined in its business judgment that Messrs. Aguirre, Harrington and Newhouse and Ms.
Hancock, based on his or her background and experience (including that described in this Proxy Statement), has the requisite attributes of an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; as defined by the SEC. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Committee assists the Board in its oversight of (1)&nbsp;the integrity of the financial statements of the Company, (2)&nbsp;the qualifications and
independence of the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm (the &#147;Independent Accountants&#148;), (3)&nbsp;the performance of the Company&#146;s internal audit function and the Independent Accountants, and (4)&nbsp;the
compliance by the Company with legal and regulatory requirements. The Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the work of the Independent Accountants and any other accounting firm engaged to
perform audit, review or attest services (including the resolution of any disagreements between management and any auditor regarding financial reporting). The Independent Accountants and any other such accounting firm report directly to the
Committee. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Committee operates pursuant to a Charter that was last amended and restated by the Board on January&nbsp;18, 2013 and last reviewed
by the Committee on November&nbsp;20, 2014. The Audit Committee Charter can be found at <B>www.aetna.com/investors-aetna/governance/ committees.html.</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">As set forth in the Audit Committee Charter, Aetna&#146;s management is responsible for the preparation, presentation and integrity of Aetna&#146;s
financial statements
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
and management&#146;s annual assessment of Aetna&#146;s internal control over financial reporting. Aetna&#146;s management is responsible for maintaining appropriate accounting and financial
reporting principles and policies and internal controls and procedures designed to assure compliance with accounting standards and applicable laws and regulations. The Independent Accountants are responsible for planning and carrying out proper
annual audits and quarterly reviews of Aetna&#146;s financial statements. In conjunction with the Company&#146;s annual report, the Independent Accountants express an opinion as to the conformity of the Company&#146;s financial statements with
U.S.&nbsp;generally accepted accounting principles and the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting. The Independent Accountants also provide review reports regarding the Company&#146;s quarterly financial
statements. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In the performance of its oversight function, the Committee has reviewed and discussed the Company&#146;s audited financial statements
for 2014 with management and the Independent Accountants. The Committee has also discussed with the Independent Accountants the matters required to be discussed by the Statement on Auditing Standards No.&nbsp;61, as amended (AICPA Professional
Standards, Vol. 1, AU section 380), as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) and Rule 3200T and/or Auditing Standard No.&nbsp;16, Communications with Audit Committees, as adopted by the Public Company Accounting
Oversight Board (United States). The Committee has also received the written disclosures and the letter from the Independent Accountants required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the Independent
Accountants&#146; communications with the Committee concerning independence, and has discussed with the Independent Accountants their independence.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>II. APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Members of the Committee are not employees of Aetna and, as such, it is not the duty or responsibility of
the Committee or its members to conduct auditing or accounting reviews or procedures. In performing their oversight responsibility, members of the Committee rely on information, opinions, reports and statements, including financial statements and
other financial data, prepared or presented by officers or employees of Aetna, legal counsel, the Independent Accountants or other persons with professional or expert competence. Accordingly, the Committee&#146;s oversight does not provide an
independent basis to determine that management has maintained appropriate accounting and financial reporting principles and policies, or internal controls and procedures designed to assure compliance with accounting standards and applicable laws and
regulations. Furthermore, the Committee&#146;s considerations and discussions referred to above do not assure that the audit of the Company&#146;s financial statements by the Independent Accountants has been carried out in accordance with the
standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
States), that the Company&#146;s financial statements are presented in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles, that the Company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting is effective or that the Independent Accountants are in fact &#147;independent.&#148; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Based upon the reports, review and discussions
described in this Report, and subject to the limitations on the role and responsibilities of the Committee, certain of which are referred to above and in its Charter, the Committee recommended to the Board that the audited financial statements be
included in Aetna&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 filed with the SEC. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>The Audit Committee </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Richard J. Harrington, <I>Chair</I> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Fernando Aguirre </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ellen M. Hancock </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Joseph P. Newhouse </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Olympia J. Snowe </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:42pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:20pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_40"></A>II.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" STYLE="font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:30pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Audit Committee has appointed KPMG LLP to audit the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements
for 2015. The Audit Committee and the Board believe that the retention of KPMG LLP as the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders. The Audit Committee and the Board
recommend that shareholders approve KPMG LLP as the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm (the &#147;Independent Accountants&#148;) for 2015. Representatives of the firm are expected to be available at the Annual Meeting to
make a statement if the firm desires and to respond to appropriate questions. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Nonaudit Services and Other Relationships Between the Company and the Independent
Registered Public Accounting Firm </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Company&#146;s practice is not to have its Independent Accountants provide financial information systems
design and implementation consulting services. Instead, these services are provided by other accounting or consulting firms. Other types of permissible consulting services have been provided by the Independent Accountants or other accounting and
consulting firms from time to time. All new
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
services provided by the Independent Accountants must be approved in advance by the Audit Committee regardless of the size of the engagement. The Chair of the Audit Committee may approve any
proposed engagements that arise between Committee meetings, provided that any such decision is presented to the full Committee at its next scheduled meeting. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In addition, management may not hire as an employee a person who within the last three years was an employee of the Independent Accountants and
participated in the audit engagement of the Company&#146;s financial statements if the hiring is prohibited by SEC rules or if the Audit Committee determines that the hiring of such person would impair the independence of the Independent
Accountants. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The independence of the Independent Accountants is considered annually by the Audit Committee and Board. In order to assure continuing
auditor independence, the Audit Committee periodically considers whether to rotate the independent registered public accounting firm. In conjunction with the mandated rotation of the Independent Accountants&#146; lead engagement partner, the Audit
Committee is directly involved in the selection of the Independent Accountants&#146; new lead engagement partner. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>56</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>III. APPROVAL OF THE COMPANY&#146;S EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION ON A NON-BINDING ADVISORY BASIS </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Fees Incurred for 2014 and 2013 Services Performed by the Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Audit Committee oversees the fee negotiations for all services rendered to the Company by the Independent Accountants. The table below provides
details of the fees paid to KPMG LLP by the Company for services rendered in
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
2014 and 2013. All such services were approved in advance by the Audit Committee or the Chair of the Audit Committee. As shown in the table below, audit and audit-related fees totaled
approximately 98% of the aggregate fees paid to KPMG LLP for 2014 and 2013; and tax fees made up the remainder. There were no other fees paid to KPMG LLP in 2014 or 2013.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">
