<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS AND THE ANNUAL MEETING </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
voted on at the Annual Meeting are not considered routine under the applicable rules, and therefore brokerage firms may not vote uninstructed shares on any of those proposals. Any uninstructed
shares you hold through any of
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
the 401(k) Plans will be voted by the trustee of the applicable 401(k) Plan in the same percentage as the shares held through that 401(k) Plan for which the trustee receives voting instructions.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What Does It Mean If I Receive More Than One Set
of Proxy Materials? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">It means your
shares are registered differently or are in more than one account. Please provide voting instructions for all of the Notices and proxy and voting instruction cards you receive. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What Should I Do If I Want to Attend the Annual Meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The Annual Meeting will be held at the JW Marriott Miami, in Miami, Florida. Directions to the JW Marriott
are on page B-1. The Annual Meeting is open to all shareholders as of the RECORD DATE (the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015) or their authorized representatives. Anyone who
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
attends the Annual Meeting must have an admission ticket. Follow the instructions below under &#147;How Can I Obtain an Admission Ticket for the Annual Meeting?&#148; to obtain an admission
ticket. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>How Can I Obtain an Admission Ticket For the
Annual Meeting? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In accordance with Aetna&#146;s security procedures, anyone wishing to attend the Annual Meeting must have
an admission ticket issued in his or her name. Admission is limited to: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">Shareholders at the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015; </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">An authorized proxy holder of a shareholder of record at the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015; or </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">An authorized representative of a shareholder of record who has been designated to present a shareholder proposal. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">You must provide evidence of your ownership of shares with your ticket request and follow the requirements for obtaining an admission ticket specified in
the &#147;ADMISSION
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
AND TICKET REQUEST PROCEDURE&#148; on page 71.<B> Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary must receive your request for an admission ticket on or before May&nbsp;8, 2015.</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>No weapons, cameras, audio or video recording equipment, electronic devices, large bags, briefcases or packages will be permitted in the Annual
Meeting.</B> Please note that, for security reasons, all bags may be searched, and all persons who attend the Annual Meeting may be required to pass through a metal detector. We will be unable to admit anyone to the Annual Meeting who does not
comply with these security procedures. No one will be admitted to the Annual Meeting once the meeting has commenced. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Can I Listen to the Annual Meeting If I
Don&#146;t Attend in Person? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Yes. You
can listen to the live audio webcast of the Annual Meeting by going to Aetna&#146;s Internet website at <B>www.aetna.com/investor</B> and then clicking on the link to the webcast. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Where Can I Find the Voting Results of the Annual Meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">We will publish the voting results of the Annual
Meeting in a Current Report on Form 8-K within four business days after the Annual Meeting, and you will be able to find this report on Aetna&#146;s Internet website at <B>www.aetna.com/investor</B>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What Class of Shares Is Entitled to Be Voted? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Each share of Common Stock outstanding as of the RECORD DATE (the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015) is entitled to one vote at the Annual
Meeting. At the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015, 349,115,579 shares of Common Stock were outstanding. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS AND THE ANNUAL MEETING </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>How Many Shares Must Be Present to Hold the Annual Meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">A majority of the shares of Common Stock outstanding as of the RECORD DATE (the close of business on
March&nbsp;13, 2015) must be present in person or by proxy for us to hold the Annual Meeting and transact business. This is referred to as a quorum. Shares subject to broker nonvotes are counted as present for the purpose of determining the presence
of a quorum if the broker votes the shares on a routine matter, such as the appointment of the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm. Generally,
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
broker nonvotes occur when shares held by a broker for a beneficial owner are not voted with respect to a particular proposal because the proposal is not a routine matter, and the broker has not
received voting instructions from the beneficial owner of the shares. If you abstain from voting on one or more proposals, your shares will be counted as present for purposes of determining the presence of a quorum even if you abstain on all
proposals. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What Is the Voting Requirement to Approve Each of
the Proposals, and How Will Votes Be Counted? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under Pennsylvania corporation law and Aetna&#146;s Articles of Incorporation and By-Laws, the approval of
any corporate action taken at the Annual Meeting is based on votes cast. For the proposals that will be considered at the Annual Meeting, shareholder approval occurs if the votes cast in favor of the proposal exceed the votes cast against the
proposal. &#147;Votes cast&#148; on these proposals means votes &#147;for&#148; or &#147;against&#148; a particular proposal, whether by proxy or in person. Abstentions and broker nonvotes are not considered &#147;votes cast&#148; on these proposals
and therefore have no effect on the outcome. In uncontested elections, Directors are elected by a majority of votes cast. As
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
described in more detail on page 2 under &#147;Director Elections &#151; Majority Voting Standard,&#148; in uncontested elections, Aetna&#146;s Corporate Governance Guidelines require any
incumbent Director nominee who receives more &#147;against&#148; votes than &#147;for&#148; votes to promptly submit his or her resignation for consideration by the Nominating Committee and the Board. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">If you are a beneficial owner and do not provide the shareholder of record with voting instructions, your shares may constitute broker nonvotes, as
described under &#147;How Many Shares Must Be Present to Hold the Annual Meeting?&#148; above. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Who Will Bear the Cost of Soliciting Votes For
the Annual Meeting? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Aetna will pay the entire cost of preparing, assembling, printing, mailing and distributing these proxy
materials and the Notice, except that you will pay for Internet access if you choose to access these proxy materials over the Internet. In addition to the mailing of these proxy materials, the solicitation of proxies or votes may be made in person,
by telephone or by electronic communication by our Directors, officers and employees, none of whom will receive any additional compensation for such solicitation activities. We
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
also have hired Georgeson Inc. to assist us in the solicitation of votes for a fee of $22,000 plus reasonable out-of-pocket expenses for these services, which vary from year to year. We also will
reimburse brokerage houses and other custodians, nominees and fiduciaries for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses for forwarding proxy and solicitation materials to beneficial owners of Common Stock and obtaining their voting instructions.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Does Aetna Allow Shareholders to Choose to View
Annual Reports to Shareholders and Proxy Statements Via the Internet? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Yes. Aetna allows shareholders of record to choose to view future annual reports to shareholders and proxy
statements via the Internet instead of receiving paper copies of these documents in the mail. The 2015 Aetna Inc. Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement and 2014 Aetna Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders are available on
Aetna&#146;s Internet website at <B>www.aetna.com/proxymaterials</B>. Under Pennsylvania law, Aetna may provide shareholders who give Aetna their e-mail addresses with electronic notice of its shareholder meetings as described below.
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">If you are a shareholder of record, you can choose to view annual reports to shareholders and proxy
statements via the Internet and save Aetna the cost of producing and mailing these documents in the future by following the instructions under &#147;How Do I Elect to View Annual Reports to Shareholders and Proxy Statements Via the Internet?&#148;
on page 68. If&nbsp;you hold your shares through a stockbroker, bank or other holder of record, check the information provided by that entity for instructions on how to elect to view future notices of shareholder meetings, proxy statements and
annual reports via the Internet. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS AND THE ANNUAL MEETING </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">If you are a shareholder of record and choose to receive future notices of shareholder meetings by e-mail
and view future annual reports and proxy statements over the Internet, you must supply an e-mail address, and you will receive your notice of the meeting by e-mail when those materials are posted. The notice you receive will include instructions and
contain the Internet address for those materials. </P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Many shareholders who hold their shares through a stockbroker, bank or other holder of record and elect
electronic access will receive an e-mail containing the Internet address to access Aetna&#146;s notices of shareholder meetings, proxy statements and annual reports when those materials are posted.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>How Do I Elect to View Annual Reports to
Shareholders and Proxy Statements Via the Internet? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">If you are a shareholder of record and are interested in receiving future notices of shareholder meetings
by e-mail and viewing future annual reports and proxy statements via the Internet instead of receiving paper copies of these documents, you may elect this option when voting by using
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
the Internet at<B> www.proxyvote.com</B> and following the instructions. You will need to have your proxy card (or the Notice or the e-mail message you receive with instructions on how to vote)
in hand when you access the website. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What If I Get More Than One Copy of Aetna&#146;s
Annual Report? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The 2014 Aetna Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders is being mailed to shareholders in advance
of, or together with, this Proxy Statement. If you hold Aetna shares in your own name and received more than one copy of the 2014 Aetna Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders at your address and wish to reduce the number of reports you
receive and save Aetna the cost of producing and mailing these reports, you should contact Aetna&#146;s Transfer Agent at 1-800-446-2617 to discontinue the mailing of reports on the accounts you select. At least one account at your address must
continue to receive an annual report, unless you elect to view future annual reports over the Internet. The mailing of dividend checks, dividend reinvestment statements, proxy materials and special notices will not be affected by your election to
discontinue duplicate mailings of annual reports. Registered shareholders may resume the mailing of an annual report to an account by calling Aetna&#146;s Transfer Agent at 1-800-446-2617. If you own shares through a stockbroker, bank or
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
other holder of record and received more than one 2014 Aetna Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders, please contact the holder of record to eliminate duplicate mailings. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">&#147;Householding&#148; occurs when a single copy of our annual report and proxy statement is sent to any household at which two or more shareholders
reside if they appear to be members of the same family. This procedure reduces our printing and mailing costs and fees. Shareholders who participate in householding will continue to receive separate proxy cards, and householding will not affect the
mailing of account statements or special notices in any way. We do not currently household for registered shareholders, but we plan to begin householding for registered shareholders in 2016. If you are a registered shareholder, please check the
appropriate box on your proxy card or when you vote by Internet or phone if you would like to participate in our householding program. A number of brokerage firms have instituted householding for shares held in street name.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What If a Director Nominee Is Unwilling or Unable
to Serve? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">If for any reason one or more
of Aetna&#146;s nominees is not available to be a candidate for Director, the persons named as proxy holders on your proxy card may vote your shares for such other candidate or candidates as may be nominated by the Board, or the Board may reduce the
number of Directors to be elected. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>What Happens If Additional Proposals Are Presented at the Meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Other than the election of Directors and the other proposals described in this Proxy Statement, Aetna has
not received proper notice of, and is not aware of, any matters to be presented for a vote at the Annual Meeting. If you grant a proxy using your proxy card, the persons named as proxies on your proxy card, or any of them, will have discretion to,
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
and intend to, vote your shares according to their best judgment on any additional proposals or other matters properly presented for a vote at the Annual Meeting, including, among other things,
consideration of a motion to adjourn the Annual Meeting to another time or place. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>68</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="right"><B>QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS AND THE ANNUAL MEETING </B></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Can I Propose Actions for Consideration at Next Year&#146;s Annual Meeting of Shareholders or
Nominate Individuals to Serve as Directors? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Yes. You can submit proposals for consideration at future annual meetings, including Director nominations.
</P> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">SHAREHOLDER PROPOSALS: In order for a shareholder proposal to be considered for inclusion in Aetna&#146;s proxy statement for the 2016 Annual Meeting, the
written proposal must be RECEIVED by Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary no later than the close of business Eastern time on December 4, 2015. Such proposals must be sent to: Corporate Secretary, Aetna Inc., 151 Farmington Avenue, RW61, Hartford, CT
06156. Such proposals also will need to comply with the SEC&#146;s rules and regulations, namely Rule 14a-8 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, regarding the inclusion of shareholder proposals in Aetna-sponsored proxy materials.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">In order for a shareholder proposal to be raised from the floor during the 2016 Annual Meeting instead of being submitted for inclusion in Aetna&#146;s proxy
statement, the shareholder&#146;s written notice must be RECEIVED by Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary at least 90 calendar days before the date of the 2016 Annual Meeting and must contain the information required by Aetna&#146;s By-Laws. Please note
that the 90-day advance notice requirement relates only to matters a shareholder wishes to bring before the 2016 Annual Meeting from the floor. It does not apply to proposals a shareholder wishes to have included in Aetna&#146;s proxy statement;
that procedure is explained in the immediately preceding paragraph.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">NOMINATION OF DIRECTOR CANDIDATES: You may propose Director candidates for consideration by the Nominating Committee. In addition, Aetna&#146;s By-Laws
permit shareholders to nominate Directors for consideration at a meeting of shareholders at which one or more Directors are to be elected. In order to nominate a Director candidate at the 2016 Annual Meeting, the shareholder&#146;s written notice
must be RECEIVED by Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary at least 90 calendar days before the date of the 2016 Annual Meeting and must contain the information required by Aetna&#146;s By-Laws. (Please see &#147;Consideration of Director
Nominees-Director Qualifications&#148; on page 11 for a description of qualifications that the Board believes are required for Board nominees.) </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">COPY OF BY-LAW PROVISIONS: You may contact the Corporate Secretary at Aetna&#146;s headquarters, 151 Farmington Avenue, RW61, Hartford, CT 06156, for a copy
of the relevant provisions of Aetna&#146;s By-Laws regarding the requirements for making shareholder proposals and nominating Director candidates. You also can visit Aetna&#146;s website at <B>www.aetna.com/governance</B> to review and download a
copy of Aetna&#146;s By-Laws. </P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Can Shareholders Ask Questions at the Annual
Meeting? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Yes. You can ask questions
regarding each of the items to be voted on when those items are discussed at the Annual Meeting. Shareholders also will have an opportunity to ask questions of general interest at the end of the Annual Meeting. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Who Counts the Votes Cast at the Annual Meeting? </B></P> <P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Votes are counted by employees of Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. and certified by the judge of
election for the Annual Meeting who is an employee of Governance Consulting Services, LLC, an independent consultant of Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. The judge will determine the number of shares outstanding and the voting power of
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
each share, determine the shares represented at the Annual Meeting, determine the existence of a quorum, determine the validity of proxies and ballots, count all votes and determine the results
of the actions taken at the Annual Meeting. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Is My Vote Confidential? </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Yes. The vote of each shareholder is held in confidence from Aetna&#146;s Directors, officers and
employees except (a)&nbsp;as necessary to meet applicable legal requirements (including stock exchange listing requirements) and to assert or defend claims for or against Aetna and/or one or more of its consolidated subsidiaries, (b)&nbsp;as
necessary to assist in
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
resolving any dispute about the authenticity or accuracy of a proxy card, consent, ballot, authorization or vote, (c)&nbsp;if there is a contested proxy solicitation, (d)&nbsp;if a shareholder
makes a written comment on a proxy card or other means of voting or otherwise communicates to management, or (e)&nbsp;as necessary to obtain a quorum.
</P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:27pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Contact Information </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">If you have questions or need more information about the Annual Meeting, write to: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Office of the Corporate Secretary </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>Aetna Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">151 Farmington Avenue, RW61 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Hartford, CT 06156 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">or email us at <I>shareholderrelations@aetna.com</I>.
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">For information about your record holdings or Computershare Investment Plan account, call Computershare
Trust&nbsp;Company,&nbsp;N.A. at 1-800-446-2617 or access your account via the Internet at <B>www.computershare.com/investor</B>. We also invite you to visit Aetna&#146;s website at <B>www.aetna.com</B>. Website addresses, hyperlinks and QR codes
are included for reference only. The information contained on websites referred to and/or linked to in this Proxy Statement (other than Aetna&#146;s website to the extent specifically referred to herein as required by the SEC&#146;s rules) is not
part of this proxy solicitation and is not incorporated by reference into this Proxy Statement or any other proxy materials. References to competitors and other companies throughout this Proxy Statement are for illustrative or comparison purposes
only and do not indicate that these companies are Aetna&#146;s only competitors or are Aetna&#146;s closest competitors. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Financial Statements </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The 2014 Aetna Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders (the &#147;Annual Report&#148;) includes
the Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm, which includes an opinion on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013 and for each of the three years in the three-year period ending
December&nbsp;31, 2014, as well as an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2014. The Annual Report also contains Management&#146;s Discussion and
</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations together with the Consolidated Financial Statements and related Notes as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013 and for each of the three
years in the three-year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2014. Other information provided in the Annual Report includes Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting, Selected Financial Data for the most recent five years,
Quarterly Financial Data for 2014 and 2013 and a Corporate Performance Graph. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:13pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>SEC Form 10-K </B></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>Shareholders may obtain a copy of
Aetna&#146;s 2014 Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the SEC, including the financial statements and the financial statement schedules, without charge by calling 1-800-237-4273, by visiting Aetna&#146;s website at www.aetna.com or by mailing a
written request to Judith H. Jones, Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary, at 151 Farmington Avenue, RW61, Hartford, CT 06156. </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:4pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">By order of the Board of Directors,
</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">

 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>Judith H. Jones </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>Vice
President and Corporate Secretary </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">April&nbsp;3, 2015 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><B>70</B></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>AETNA INC. </B><I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I><B></B></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:22pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_47"></A>ADMISSION AND TICKET REQUEST PROCEDURE </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:27pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;
</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">Admission </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Admission is limited to shareholders of record at the close of business on March&nbsp;13, 2015, or one individual designated as a shareholder&#146;s
authorized proxy holder or one representative designated in writing to present a shareholder proposal. In each case, the individual must have an admission ticket and valid government issued photo identification (e.g., a driver&#146;s license or a
passport) to be admitted to the Annual Meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">Ticket Request Deadline </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Ticket requests must include all information specified in the applicable table below and be submitted in writing and received by Aetna on or before
May&nbsp;8, 2015. No requests will be processed after that date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">To Submit a Request </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Submit ticket requests by mail to Office of the Corporate Secretary, 151 Farmington Avenue, RW61, Hartford, CT 06156 or by facsimile to 860-293-1361.
Ticket requests will not be accepted by telephone or e-mail. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9pt;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">Authorized Proxy Representative </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">A shareholder may appoint a representative to attend the Annual Meeting and/or vote on his/her behalf. The admission ticket must be requested by the
shareholder but will be issued in the name of the authorized representative. Individuals holding admission tickets that are not issued in their name will not be admitted to the Annual Meeting. The shareholder information specified below and a
written proxy authorization must accompany the ticket request. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">Proponent of a Shareholder Proposal </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">For each shareholder proposal included in this Proxy Statement, the shareholder sponsor should notify the Company in writing of the individual authorized
to present the proposal on behalf of the shareholder at the Annual Meeting. One admission ticket will be issued for the designated representative if the advance registration instructions on this page and page 66 are followed. Shareholder sponsors
and their designated representatives must have an admission ticket to be admitted to the Annual Meeting. </P></DIV><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt">&nbsp;</div>
 <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.38em; text-indent:-0.38em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;Name(s) of shareholder;</P>

<P STYLE="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.75em; text-indent:-0.75em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Also include:</B></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:0.38em; text-indent:-0.38em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55">&#149;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;Address where ticket should be mailed</P></TD>

card showing shareholder name and address</P> <P STYLE="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Also

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:22pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_48"></A>ANNEX A </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:27pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Reconciliation of Certain Amounts to the Most Directly </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Comparable GAAP
Measure </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Operating earnings and operating earnings per share exclude from net income attributable to Aetna amortization of other acquired
intangible assets, net realized capital gains and losses and other items, if any, that neither relate to the ordinary course of our business nor reflect our underlying business performance. Although the excluded items may recur, management believes
that operating earnings and operating earnings per share provide a more useful comparison of Aetna&#146;s underlying business performance from period to period. Management uses operating earnings to assess business performance and to make decisions
regarding Aetna&#146;s operations and allocation of resources among Aetna&#146;s businesses. Operating earnings is also the measure reported to the Chief Executive Officer for these purposes. Refer below for a reconciliation of operating earnings
and operating earnings per share to the most directly comparable Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;) measure. Non-GAAP financial measures we disclose, such as operating earnings, operating earnings per share, operating
revenue, pretax operating margin, adjusted operating earnings per share, adjusted revenue, and G&amp;A as a % of revenue should not be considered a substitute for, or superior to, financial measures determined or calculated in accordance with GAAP.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The following is a reconciliation of operating earnings and operating earnings per share to the most directly comparable GAAP measure for the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 through 2010: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">In order to provide useful information regarding Aetna&#146;s profitability on a basis comparable to others in the
industry, without regard to financing decisions, income taxes or amortization of other acquired intangible assets (each of which may vary for reasons not directly related to the performance of the underlying business), Aetna&#146;s pretax operating
margin is based on operating earnings excluding interest expense and income taxes. Management also uses pretax operating margin to assess Aetna&#146;s performance, including performance versus competitors. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="96%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><B>A-1</B></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">3.5</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">%&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Under our annual bonus program (the &#147;ABP&#148;), bonus pool funding is determined by the Committee on Compensation
and Talent Management using non-GAAP metrics to measure actual performance. The following is a reconciliation of the actual performance metrics used in determining the bonus pool funding to the most directly comparable GAAP measure for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2014: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="88%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:22pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B><A NAME="toc864659_49"></A>ANNEX B </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:27pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Directions to the JW Marriott Miami, in Miami, Florida </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:17pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>From Miami
International Airport </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>1109 Brickell Avenue </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>Miami, Florida 33131 USA </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Head south toward
Miad Circle </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.6 miles. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Continue straight
onto NW 21st St. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Take the ramp and take exit 4 toward Florida 953 S/Le Jeune Rd/Coral Cables/Florida 836. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.4 miles and merge onto FL-953 S/NW 42nd Ave/S Le Jeune Rd via the ramp on the left to FL-836 W. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.3 miles and merge onto FL-836 E via the ramp to Downtown (partial toll road). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 3.9 miles and take the exit onto I-95 S toward Downtown. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 1.2 miles and take exit 2C on the left for Miami Ave toward Downtown. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.3 miles and merge onto Downtown Distributor (signs for US-1 N/Biscayne Blvd). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.3 miles and turn right onto SE 2nd Ave. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.2 miles. SE 2nd Ave turns slightly left and becomes Brickell Ave. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.2 miles and turn left onto SE 8th St/Carlos Arboleya Blvd. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Take the 1st right onto Brickell Bay Dr. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Travel 0.3
miles and take the 2nd right onto SE 12th St. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Turn right onto Brickell Ave. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">The hotel will be on the right. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:18pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>The Aetna Way is an expression of why we exist, </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:18pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>what we are trying to achieve and what we believe in. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:30pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g864659g62j68.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify">Everything we do at Aetna starts with our values &#151; a clear, strongly held set of core beliefs that reflect who
we are and what you can expect from us. </P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">


<IMG SRC="g864659g98t06.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>151 Farmington Avenue </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><B>Hartford, Connecticut 06156 </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:30pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="65%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9.5pt">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="97%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="13" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="13" COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9.5pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><FONT COLOR="#ab2b55"><B>THE AETNA STORY: Building healthier communities, a healthier nation and a healthier world.</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><I>Founded in 1853 in Hartford, Connecticut, Aetna is one of the
nation&#146;s leading diversified health care benefits companies. We help people achieve health and financial security by offering a broad range of traditional, voluntary and consumer-directed health insurance products and related services,
including medical, pharmacy, dental, behavioral health, group life and disability plans, and medical management capabilities, Medicaid health care management services, workers&#146; compensation administrative services and health information
technology products and services.</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><I>We currently serve
approximately 46 million people with information and resources to help them make better informed decisions about their health care. Our customers include employer groups, individuals, college students, part-time and hourly workers, health plans,
governmental units, government-sponsored plans, labor groups and expatriates.</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9.5pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="justify"><I>We believe everyone deserves easy access to cost-effective, high-quality health care. That&#146;s why we are working to transform the health care
system. Our goal is simple we want to create healthier communities, a healthier nation and a healthier world.</I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:20pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #ab2b55"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #ab2b55; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #ab2b55">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="right">


<IMG SRC="g864659g62b92.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>VOTE BY INTERNET - <U>www.proxyvote.com</U></B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Use the Internet to transmit your voting instructions and for electronic delivery of information up until 11:59 P.M. Eastern Time on
May&nbsp;14, 2015. Have your proxy card in hand when you access the website and follow the instructions to obtain your records and to create an electronic voting instruction form.</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>ELECTRONIC DELIVERY OF FUTURE PROXY MATERIALS</B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If you would like to reduce the costs incurred by our company in mailing proxy materials, you can consent to receiving all future proxy
statements, proxy cards and annual reports electronically via e-mail or the Internet. To sign up for electronic delivery, please follow the instructions above to vote using the Internet and, when prompted, indicate that you agree to receive or
access proxy materials electronically in future years.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>VOTE BY PHONE - 1-800-690-6903</B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If you are calling from the United States or Puerto Rico, use any touch-tone telephone to transmit your voting instructions up until 11:59
P.M. Eastern Time on May&nbsp;14, 2015. Have your proxy card in hand when you call and then follow the instructions.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">Mark, sign and date your proxy card and return it in the postage-paid envelope we have provided or return it to Vote Processing, c/o Broadridge, 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717.</TD></TR>

attorney, executor, administrator, trustee or guardian, please give your full title as such. If a corporation or other form of entity, please sign in the full name of the entity, by a duly authorized officer. The signer hereby revokes all proxies
heretofore given by the signer to vote at the 2015 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Aetna Inc. and any adjournment or postponement thereof. </P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>2015 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>OF </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>AETNA INC.
</I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>FRIDAY, MAY 15, 2015, 9:30 AM EASTERN TIME </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>JW MARRIOTT MIAMI </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>1109 BRICKELL AVENUE </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>MIAMI, FL 33131 </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:6%; margin-right:6%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Your vote is important to us. You may vote your proxy by Internet, telephone or mail. Please vote your proxy at your earliest
convenience even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting. Voting instructions appear on the reverse side of this card. Your vote is held in confidence by the Company&#146;s outside tabulator, Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:6%; margin-right:6%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>NOTE:</B> If you plan to attend the meeting, you must follow the admission and ticket request procedure in the 2015 Proxy
Statement. Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary must receive your written request for an admission ticket on or before May&nbsp;8, 2015. You must present your admission ticket along with a <B>government-issued photo identification</B> (e.g., a
driver&#146;s license or passport) in order to be admitted to the Annual Meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:6%; margin-right:6%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE
AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS FOR THE 2015 ANNUAL MEETING: </B>The Aetna Inc. 2015 Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement and the Aetna Inc. 2014 Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders are available at www.aetna.com/proxymaterials.
</P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:3.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px dashed #000000">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-size:24pt"> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="line-height:2.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:2.00pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2015 Annual Meeting of Shareholders</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>THIS PROXY IS SOLICITED ON BEHALF OF AETNA&#146;S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The undersigned hereby appoints Barbara Hackman Franklin, Ellen M. Hancock, and Edward J. Ludwig, and each of them, the proxies of the undersigned, with full
power of substitution, to vote the shares of the undersigned at the 2015 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Aetna Inc. to be held on May&nbsp;15, 2015 and at any adjournment or postponement thereof, and directs said proxies to vote as specified
herein on the items specified in this proxy, and in their discretion on any other matters that may properly come before the meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof. <B>THIS PROXY, WHEN PROPERLY EXECUTED, WILL BE VOTED IN THE MANNER
DIRECTED HEREIN BY THE SHAREHOLDER. IF NO DIRECTION IS MADE, THIS PROXY WILL BE VOTED <U>FOR</U> EACH NOMINEE LISTED IN ITEM&nbsp;1, <U>FOR</U> ITEMS 2 and 3 AND <U>AGAINST</U> ITEMS 4A and 4B.</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>If you vote by telephone or the Internet, please DO NOT mail back this Proxy
Card.</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>THANK YOU FOR VOTING</B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>(Items to be voted appear on reverse side of this Proxy Card.)</I></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:18pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #000000"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>VOTE BY INTERNET - <U>www.proxyvote.com</U></B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Use the Internet to transmit your voting instructions and for electronic delivery of information up until 11:59 P.M. Eastern Time on
May&nbsp;12, 2015. Have your Voting Instruction Card in hand when you access the website and follow the instructions to obtain your records and to create an electronic voting instruction form.</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>ELECTRONIC DELIVERY OF FUTURE PROXY MATERIALS</B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If you would like to reduce the costs incurred by Aetna in mailing proxy materials, you can consent to receiving all future proxy statements,
Voting Instruction Cards and annual reports electronically via e-mail or the Internet. To sign up for electronic delivery, please follow the instructions above to vote using the Internet and, when prompted, indicate that you agree to receive or
access proxy materials electronically in future years.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>VOTE BY PHONE - 1-800-690-6903</B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If you are calling from the United States or Puerto Rico, use any touch-tone telephone to transmit your voting instructions up until 11:59
P.M. Eastern Time on May&nbsp;12, 2015. Have your Voting Instruction Card in hand when you call and then follow the instructions.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">

ONLY </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>THIS VOTING INSTRUCTION CARD IS VALID ONLY WHEN SIGNED AND DATED. </B></P>

<TD VALIGN="top">4A.</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">Shareholder Proposal on Political Contributions-Disclosure</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-top:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>NOTE:</B> Please sign exactly as your name appears hereon. When signing as attorney, executor,
administrator, trustee or guardian, please give your full title as such. If a corporation or other form of entity, please sign in the full name of the entity, by a duly authorized officer. The signer hereby revokes all voting instructions heretofore
given by the signer with respect to the shares represented hereby to be voted at the 2015 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Aetna Inc. and any adjournment or postponement thereof. </P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>2015 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>OF </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>AETNA INC.
</I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>FRIDAY, MAY 15, 2015, 9:30 AM EASTERN TIME </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>JW MARRIOTT MIAMI </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>1109 BRICKELL AVENUE </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><I>MIAMI, FL 33131 </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:6%; margin-right:6%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Your vote is important to us. You may provide voting instructions by Internet, telephone or mail. Please provide your voting
instructions at your earliest convenience even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting. Voting instructions appear on the reverse side of this card. Your individual voting instructions are held in confidence. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:6%; margin-right:6%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>NOTE:</B> If you plan to attend the meeting, you must follow the admission and ticket request procedure in the 2015 Proxy
Statement. Aetna&#146;s Corporate Secretary must receive your written request for an admission ticket on or before May&nbsp;8, 2015. You must present your admission ticket along with a <B>government-issued photo identification</B> (e.g., a
driver&#146;s license or passport) in order to be admitted to the Annual Meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:6%; margin-right:6%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE
AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS FOR THE 2015 ANNUAL MEETING:</B> The Aetna Inc. 2015 Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement and the Aetna Inc. 2014 Annual Report, Financial Report to Shareholders and Letter to the 401(k) Plan Participants are
available at www.aetna.com/proxymaterials. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:3.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px dashed #000000">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top">This Voting Instruction Card constitutes the confidential voting instructions of the participants in the Aetna 401(k) Plan (&#147;Aetna Plan&#148;) and Aetna Affiliate 401(k) Plan (&#147;Affiliate Plan&#148;) (each a
&#147;Plan&#148;, and collectively, the &#147;Plans&#148;), who have the right to instruct the trustee under each Plan to vote the shares of common stock of Aetna Inc. held under the respective Plans on their behalf, in accordance with the terms of
the respective Plans and to vote those shares in accordance with your instructions at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Aetna Inc. to be held on May&nbsp;15, 2015, and at any adjournment or postponement thereof. State Street Bank and Trust
Company is the trustee under the Aetna Plan and the Affiliate Plan. Please indicate by checking the appropriate box how you want these shares to be voted by the trustee and return this card to the trustee in the envelope provided. We would like to
remind you that your individual voting instructions are held in the strictest confidence and will not be disclosed to Aetna. <B>If you fail to provide voting instructions to the applicable trustee by 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time on May&nbsp;12, 2015, by
telephone, by Internet, or by completing, signing and returning this card, the applicable trustee will vote the shares held on your behalf in the same manner and proportion as those shares for which that trustee receives proper and timely
instructions.</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
